Systems Engineer Location - Abu Dhabi                              We are looking for a Systems Engineer to work closely with a sales representative in a defined territory. The Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and post-sales. With us you will Lead all technical aspects of a sales cycle with the Enterprise customers, from the initial RFIs, through to RFPs & RFQs when required. This includes the project management and active participation in POCs in partnership with the relevant teams both internally and within the customer and/or commercial partner. Have the ability to listen and to understand the technical requirements of the customer, reading between the lines to build a solution which outperforms the competitor offering. Be the primary technical point of contact for the customer(s) and partners in close collaboration with your sales partner. Continuously strive to improve knowledge around the Fortinet products and solutions, along with maintaining a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and Fortinet’s ability to provide long lasting protection against the ever-evolving threats. Have a strong ability to position Fortinet solutions to the customer, whether this be remotely or in person. This requires strong communication skills and the ability to confidently present through whiteboarding, technical white papers, technical plans or customer discussions. Manage your time effectively when working on multiple deals simultaneously, ensuring a positive customer experience is maintained. Maintain accurate activity, contact, and account technical information of all customers and prospects in our CRM (Salesforce). Apply if you Have a high aptitude for security technology, specifically encryption, authentication, with further knowledge of network security, intrusion detection, anti-virus, routing, switching, LAN and WAN being desirable. The CISSP accreditation would also be beneficial. Are currently or have previously worked in a pre-sales engineer role, managing end to end technical aspects of deals, through to technical closure. Can demonstrate your problem solving skills and how this has impacted key wins within your current organisation. Understand and can demonstrate your ability to build and maintain customer relationships, including your ability to effectively communicate technically to a range of both external and internal stakeholders. Have a strong understanding of RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DESWhat you can expect from us Excellent training and development opportunities, providing you with all the tools you need to be successful. An open working environment, sharing knowledge and information collaboratively and transparently, with respect to everyone’s thoughts and opinions.   The opportunity to be part of an innovative, collaborative and winning team.  A competitive salary and incentive compensation package, including stock awards, health and welfare benefits. From the start, the Fortinet vision has been to deliver broad, truly integrated, high-performance security across the IT infrastructure.  Today, we secure the largest enterprises, service providers and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network – today and into the future.  We have proven to be a truly innovative technology driven network security company with over 619 registered Global Patents. This is over 3 times more than our closest most innovative competitor! #LI - AB1

Design and implement Security policies according to the ISO 27001 guidelines Conduct regular security assessments, vulnerability scans, and penetration tests to identify and address potential weaknesses and threats according to the annual schedule plan. Monitor network traffic and system logs for potential security incidents and respond promptly to mitigate risks and minimize potential impact. Advanced knowledge with the Kaspersky environment and EDR Solutions DLP Understanding Firewall logs monitor and analysis Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate security measures into the development lifecycle of applications, systems, and infrastructure. Participate in incident detection and response efforts, including investigation, containment, and recovery. Stay updated with the latest security threats, vulnerabilities, and industry trends to proactively identify emerging risks and implement necessary controls. Participate in security awareness training programs for employees to educate them on security best practices and promote a security-conscious culture. Implement IT Security Controls & Requirements Prepare monthly/quarterly reports and dashboards showing the security analytical data Setting and testing the policies implemented on all Company Laptops/Desktops required to protect Company data from been stolen or been lost/corrupted. Review and test the network security policies/configurations to protect the Company networks from unauthorized access, cyber/virus attacks Review all vulnerability reports and take the corrective action needed Working according the ISO 27001 framework controls

job_title: Field Service Rep. I - Drilling Fluids
description: Field Service Rep. I - Drilling Fluids Date: Oct 27, 2023 Location: Cairo, C, EG We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry. Under strict supervision, works directly with both fluids and equipment supervisors and technical professionals to gain a better understanding of rig operations, company products and services; fluids, separation, and waste management technologies. Completes formal training program in fluids chemistry, volume and hydraulics calculations, routine and specialized testing, separation equipment theory and application, and learns to provide well site service to customers. Learns to operate, maintain and optimize Baroid equipment including testing, separation, and waste management equipment. Learns to adequately prepare and track inventory of palletized and bulk products and equipment spares at the rig site based on the drilling program and anticipated conditions. Assists with interpreting results of routine and specialized testing in order to provide technical solutions. Assists in the operation of some separation and waste management equipment and has knowledge of how such equipment affects overall fluid performance. Complies with health, safety and environment regulations in all aspects of job performance. Performs in a professional manner as a Halliburton representative with clients. Learns how to maintain good working relationships with operator’s representative and rig personnel. High school diploma or equivalent required. No previous work experience is required. Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) or other related Bachelor's Degree program is preferred. Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, citizenship, marital status, sex/gender, sexual preference/ orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, national origin, or any other status protected by law or regulation. job_title: Logistics Manager | Middle East Africa & Asia Pacific Utd.Arab Emir. Dubai
description: Logistics Manager | Middle East Africa & Asia Pacific Full-time Company Description Doka is a world leader in providing innovative formwork, solutions and services in all areas of construction. The company is also a global supplier of well-thought-out scaffolding solutions for a varied spectrum of applications. With 178 sales and logistics facilities in over 60 countries, Doka has a highperforming distribution network for advice, customer service and technical support on the spot and ensures that equipment is swiftly provided – no matter how big and complex the project. Doka employs 7,000 people worldwide and is a company of the Umdasch Group, which has stood for reliability, experience and trustworthiness for more than 150 years. As a customer-focused organisation, Doka understands that its greatest assets are its employees, which is why Doka is consistently looking for talented professionals who are keen to develop their career in this challenging industry. Headquartered in Dubai and Singapore, the Doka Middle East Africa & Asia Pacific (MEAAP) Area team offers support to the core functions of sales, marketing, operations, support, engineering, HR and product management. Established to offer a versatile network of products, systems and expertise, Doka MEAAP oversees some of the fastest growing economies in the world, making it an ideal partner for new and challenging projects, ranging from major infrastructure development such as metro systems, bridges and tunnels to energy sector scaffolding solutions. Job Description At Doka, the operations department in MEAAP is a critical function which overlooks and delegates, in close collaboration with the country organizations as well as the Head Quarter and other Areas, all activities necessary to ensure the availability of required material in our Area. Doka is currently looking for a Logistics Manager to join its versatile and growing MEAAP Area team. This position will bebased in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. If you are passionate about global exposure within a cross cultural environment, have an inner drive to take your passion of Logistics to the next level, this could be the perfect opportunity for you. You will be reporting directly to the Head of Operations MEAAP. Responsibilities: Coordinate and manage Material Logistics and inventory levels of Doka items in the Area Middle East Africa & Asia Pacific (MEAAP) Monitor and optimize stock levels for all Doka items to ensure availability at lowest possible costs and inventory levels Support, inform and develop MEAAP countries in all aspects of Material Logistics Implement and maintain new group-wide standards and processes, improve existing processes Develop, support and drive optimisation concepts and share best practices Lead and guide the Area Logistics team and Logistics managers in the MEAAP countries during daily operation Monitor and escalate (non-) availability of material from Doka Production, external suppliers and (non-) release of intercompany demand Act as business partner for Procurement team of MEAAP Ensure accurate forecasting, data quality of demands and supplies as well as return planning in MEAAP countries Maintain correct and relevant master data for MEAAP countries in Rapid Response Act as link and MEAAP voice between Logistics Doka Group, other Areas and MEAAP countries Support implementations and improvements of relevant software tools Ensure and maintain reporting transparency in regards to Material Logistics (with Power BI) Coordinate and execute trainings for MEAAP countries including regular qualification assessment for each country Ensure utilization of statistical declarations Support the execution of direct exports to MEAAP export countries Qualifications Min. 5 years’ experience in Material Logistics and Procurement (preferably in formwork/construction and in Middle East Africa and/ or Asia Pacific) Degree in Business, Supply Chain or Operations related studies is an advantage Knowledge of free trade agreements in Middle East Africa and Asia Pacific Team management experience in an international environment Excellent communication, intercultural and problem-solving skills Ability to work under pressure and go the extra mile Strong analytical skills Well organised and efficient Process and improvement driven Pro-active and solution/target oriented Resilient and decisive Be a role model and inspiring Excellent English language skills Power BI Skills will be a strong advantage Logistics Manager | Middle East Africa & Asia Pacific Jebel Ali Freezone South, Dubai, ae * Full-time

description: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented IT Project Management Intern to join our team. As an intern, you will play a crucial role in assisting our project managers with various tasks related to Cloud Computing and Managed Services projects. This internship will provide you with hands-on experience in project management, cloud technologies, and IT services. description: Job details Location: Dubai  Salary: Competitive Salary  Job Type: Permanent  Discipline: IT & Technology Reference: 936041  Posted: 3 days ago  Share this job  Job description ​Charterhouse is working with a client, a prominent Oil and Gas company, who is seeking a dedicated and experienced IT Service Delivery Specialist to join their dynamic team. This role will play a crucial role in ensuring seamless IT support for all system users. Reporting to the IT Service Delivery Team Lead, the selected candidate will have the opportunity to work in the Finance, IT, and Supply Chain departments and make a significant impact on the company's IT infrastructure. About the role The IT Service Delivery Specialist’s primary mission will be to provide comprehensive support to all IT system users, resolving issues related to computers, peripherals, data, applications, and networking, regardless of whether they are onshore or offshore. This role will work closely with a team of IT Service Engineers, to be the initial point of contact for all IT support requests. The Specialist will be responsible for advanced technical troubleshooting and problem-solving, as well as the management of computer equipment, applications and accessories. Additionally, this role will ensure that incidents are resolved or escalated according to IT policy, maintaining the IT Asset Management platform, and adhering to ITIL processes for Incident, Problem, Request Fulfilment, and Change. In conjunction, the Specialist will be responsible for helpdesk support, including after-hours support on rotation. About you To be considered for this role, the candidate should possess a College Diploma in Computer Science or a related IT subject, a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer is preferred. You should have at least 5 years of previous technical IT work experience, with a background in System Administration, Networking, or IT Support, and it would be a bonus if you have experience supporting technical engineering or geoscience applications. Key competencies include advanced knowledge of Windows operating systems, business applications and databases. Proficiency in MS Office, MS Project, MS Access, SQL, Oracle, Citrix, Active Directory, System Centre Configuration Manager, and Exchange management is essential. Familiarity with ITIL v3 is a plus. The ideal candidate should be proactive and possess strong communication skills, be able to work well under pressure and demonstrate a dedicated commitment to providing top-notch customer service.

description:
Petrofac is a leading international service provider to the energy industry, with a diverse client portfolio including many of the world’s leading energy companies. We design, build, manage and maintain infrastructure for our clients. We recruit, reward, and develop our people based on merit regardless of race, nationality, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, marital status or disability. We value our people and treat everyone who works for or with Petrofac fairly and without discrimination. The world is re-thinking its energy supply and energy security needs, planning for a phased transition to alternative energy sources. We are here to help our clients meet these evolving energy needs. This is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We support flexible working requests and have adopted a hybrid approach for most of our office-based roles. We ask employees to be present in the office at least three days per week. Are you ready to bring the right energy to Petrofac and help us deliver a better future for everyone? Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic Technical Training Specialist to join our team. As a Technical Training Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering high-quality technical training programs to enable our employees and clients to enhance their skills and knowledge in various technical domains. You will collaborate closely with subject matter experts, instructional designers, and stakeholders to create effective training materials and deliver engaging training sessions. Responsibilities: Training Program Development: Collaborate with subject matter experts to design and develop comprehensive technical training programs tailored to the needs of different audiences. Training Material Creation: Create engaging and interactive training materials, including presentations, guides, hands-on exercises, and assessments, to facilitate effective learning experiences. Training Delivery: Conduct training sessions, workshops, and webinars both in-person and virtually, ensuring a dynamic and engaging learning environment. Knowledge Transfer: Effectively communicate technical concepts and information to diverse audiences, fostering understanding and practical application of the training content. Training Evaluation: Assess the effectiveness of training programs through participant feedback, evaluations, and performance metrics, and make improvements as needed. Training Documentation: Develop training documentation, including user guides, reference materials, and job aids, to support ongoing learning and development. Technology Adoption: Assist in driving the adoption of new technologies and tools by providing training and support to internal teams and clients. Collaboration and Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, subject matter experts, and stakeholders to ensure training programs align with business objectives and requirements. Stay Updated: Continuously enhance your own technical knowledge and instructional design skills, staying informed about industry trends and advancements.
requirements: Technical Expertise: Strong understanding and practical experience in one or more technical domains, such as software development, data analytics, cloud computing, cybersecurity, or networking. Training Experience: Proven experience in designing and delivering technical training programs, both in-person and virtually, using various instructional techniques and tools. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts in a clear and accessible manner. Instructional Design Knowledge: Familiarity with instructional design principles and adult learning methodologies to create effective training materials and experiences. Adaptability: Ability to adapt training approaches and materials to suit different learning styles, skill levels, and audience needs. Collaboration: Strong teamwork and collaboration skills to work effectively with subject matter experts, trainers, and stakeholders. Problem-Solving: Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to address training challenges and provide effective solutions. Continuous Learning: Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on emerging technologies and industry trends. Bachelor's Degree: A degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience is preferred.

job_title: Warehouse Assistant | Al Futtaim Automotive | Supply Chain | Global Aftersales
description:
Job Requisition ID: 157745 Established in the 1930s as a trading business, Al-Futtaim Group today is one of the most diversified and progressive, privately held regional businesses headquartered in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Structured into five operating divisions; automotive, financial services, real estate, retail and healthcare; employing more than 35,000 employees across more than 20 countries in the Middle East, Asia and Africa, Al-Futtaim Group partners with over 200 of the world's most admired and innovative brands. Al-Futtaim Group’s entrepreneurship and relentless customer focus enables the organization to continue to grow and expand; responding to the changing needs of our customers within the societies in which we operate. By upholding our values of respect, excellence, collaboration and integrity; Al-Futtaim Group continues to enrich the lives and aspirations of our customers each and every day Overview of the role: The primary responsibility of this position is to deconsolidate /sort and pack automotive spare parts and accessories error and damage free. The Warehouse Associate will need to meet or exceed established productivity and quality measures in a high performing team based environment. All safety practices, operational procedures and guidelines and company policies and procedures must be strictly adhered to at all times What you will do: Receive and deconsolidate incoming parts.
Sort, Pack and ship goods in accordance with packaging guidelines and accepted methods and practices
Store items in an orderly and accessible manner in the warehouse.
Reconcile calculated inventory with physical counts
Perform bin stock replenishment.
Follow any special instructions pertaining to an individual order
Assist in keeping facility clean, neat, safe and operating efficiently
Follow all established policy and safety guidelines in workplace.
Required Skills to be successful: Recognizes and understands part numbers and alpha/numeric codes.
Able to work independently with some direction 
Lift/carry/manoeuvre heavy material or equipment (up to 30 lbs)
Able to perform simple math operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division) 
About the Team: Reporting to Warehouse Supervisor, you will be working in a busy state of art Automotive warehouse located in Dubai Investment Park (DIP)What equips you for the role: High school education or equivalent
Capable of following written instructions and documented procedures
Able to multi-task
About Al-Futtaim Automotive A major division of the UAE-based Al-Futtaim Group of companies, Al-Futtaim Automotive is an industry leader with presence in 10 countries across the Middle East, Asia and Africa. Our core business activities at Al-Futtaim Automotive include distribution, manufacturing, leasing and aftersales, and we are firmly established as the regional representative of some of the world’s most iconic automotive brands: Toyota, Lexus, Honda, Jeep, Chrysler, Dodge, Volvo and RAM. We are driven by a customer-centric approach, constantly pushing the boundaries on innovation, quality standards, and value-added service across our vast universe of customers - right from motoring enthusiasts to fleet operators to contractors. Our mission is to become the leader in custom-made mobility solutions by delivering nothing less than world-class omni-channel experiences.  We channel our local expertise and global trust to deliver one of the most comprehensive portfolios of mobility products and solutions, from passenger cars to SUVs, electric vehicles to high-performance motorbikes, commercial vehicles to industrial & construction equipment. What keeps the company moving forward is a 9000-member strong team, with inspiring possibilities for growth, throughout the career path. This is Al-Futtaim Automotive and we empower talent to move forward.

Location UAE, Dubai Compensation Base Salary AED 120K • Offers Bonus ⚽Football Systems Operator | Launch Your Career in Sports Technology | Full-Time, Onsite at Stadiums in the UAE⚽????Location: The majority of work will take place on-site at football stadiums in your region, with further opportunities for travel across UAE and the MEA region ????Contract: Permanent, Full-Time????Salary: 120,000 AED per year????Start Date: November/December 2023????WHAT THE JOB IS ALL ABOUT As a Football Systems Operator, you will be working on-site at football stadiums in your region, playing a key part in the delivery of our services to UAE FA. As you gain experience in the role, you may be expected to be involved in more tournaments throughout the MEA Region and further afield; such as the AFC Champions League or FIFA Seminars and Competitions. The role will encompass the installation and operation of our technology at matches where you will be responsible for our systems. You will need to be prepared to work long days at weekends and midweek evenings, as we work whenever Football happens. Whilst we provide a number of services in top-flight football, you will initially focus on our Video Assistant Referee (VAR) technology. You will gain exposure to various other services as you grow in the role and become a more experienced member of the team. We will equip you with the technical training, support and full exposure to our systems to perform your day to day tasks but also encourage development and progression to help make an impact on what we do.????Key Responsibilities Pre-match planning before match-day Setting up Hawk-Eye technology in the stadium (this can involve physically demanding work, such as rigging cameras and running cables) Conducting pre-match set up, checks and calibration of the systems in accordance with standard procedures Liaising with stadium staff, match officials and host broadcasters on-site Monitoring the systems during the match Monitoring hardware and software performances, being able to troubleshoot and report encountered issues Taking full ownership of our system on-site and being an ambassador for Hawk-Eye During the off-season, building and maintaining our hardware and equipment Assisting with installation and testing of new products and services ????Skills, Knowledge and Expertise A technical grounding; with a desire to work with and learn new technologies Bright and enterprising with excellent problem-solving skills coupled with an inquisitive mindset Proactive attitude and time management skills with the ability to work on your own initiative Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced environment  Ability to liaise with clients and customers in a professional and approachable manner Willingness to travel domestically and to work overseas Flexible and adaptable to a schedule that is dedicated by the fixture list and can change at short notice  Acceptance that the nature of our business means that work will be carried out over weekends/bank holidays A full valid driving licence is required and willingness to drive our vans English language - working proficiency Nice to have:  A bachelor's degree in a science, technology, mathematics or engineering course or relevant equivalent experience Experience working with video technology/replay technology desirable, or live event/technical production Arabic speaker Hindi speaker At Hawk-Eye Innovations, we appreciate and value the importance of potential and growth. If you do not hit all of the criteria above but believe that there are certain areas you excel in and that you possess the passion and desire to develop the other attributes, then we encourage you to apply.⚽Make an Impact in the World of Football Join our dedicated and dynamic team and help revolutionise the way technology is used in Football! As a Football Systems Operator, you'll gain invaluable experience and play a crucial role in some of the biggest Football events in the world. Compensation Range: AED 120K

About Etihad Airways Etihad Airways, the national airline of the UAE, was formed in 2003 and quickly went on to become one of the world’s leading airlines. From its home in Abu Dhabi, Etihad flies to passenger and cargo destinations in the Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, Australia and North America. Together with Etihad’s codeshare partners, Etihad’s network offers access to hundreds of international destinations. In recent years, Etihad has received numerous awards for its superior service and products, cargo offering, loyalty programme and more. Etihad is recognised as one of the world’s leading airlines in response to COVID-19 and was the first airline in the world to fully vaccinate its crew on board. Etihad sees tackling the climate crisis as the most important issue of our time, and through strategic partnerships with major global aviation brands and OEMs, Etihad is relentless in its pursuit of industry decarbonisation. To learn more, visit etihad.com

Are you passionate about collaborating with technology and business leaders to deliver cloud-based solutions?At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is continually evolving and is a place where motivated employees thrive and also where employee ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. Amazon is a place where builders can build. Our internships offer exceptional opportunities for you to grow your technical and non-technical skills. From day one, you will be working with experienced engineers who love what they do. Are you ready to embrace the challenge? Come build the future with us. Associate Solutions Architect Intern The Solutions Architects (SA) organization is a diverse team that focuses on helping customers build infrastructures and applications at scale using AWS solutions. Our solutions architects are passionate technologists with technical breadth and depth coupled with strong interpersonal skills. As an SA intern, you will receive AWS technical training, immerse yourself in cloud computing, develop business acumen, presentation delivery, and learn more about Amazon culture. You will work in a one on one project environment with the possibility of group projects, complete the AWS Cloud Practitioner Certification, and attend professional development events. Amazon internships are full-time (38 hours/week) and normally run for 10-12 consecutive weeks with timelines dependent on country locations. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and Amaze Con (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Harmony Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfilment AND WE encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. JOB TITLE: Engineer I - Quality, Piping (Test pack/Hydrotest)KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Review pressure test packages as per P&ID, Isometric drawings, test limit drawings and all related documents.
Ensure installation of piping is in compliance with isometric drawings and code requirements with respect to; material, alignment, supports, valve type, valve orientation, heat trace, insulation, marking, tapings, take offs. 
Ensure satisfactory identification of materials, proper protection of piping and fittings. 
Ensure operation of flange management system to include correct flange class, flange type, alignment, gasket, orifice plate, bolts, washers, nuts, bolt torque, use of insulation kit. 
Line check prior to pressure test, ensuring provision of additional supports when required, spring hangers are locked, instruments, orifice plates and equipment are isolated or removed, blind flanges are correctly rated and certified, valves removed or isolated, vent and drain valves installed. 
Prepare punch list prior to pressure test, categorize items, ensure all A-items cleared prior to pressure test. 
Witness pressure test ensure gauges and recorders are within valid calibration, inhibitors in use as required by specification, line flushed, vented and filled. Monitor pressure and sign off records. 
Prepare final punch list of outstanding actions/items, categorize and monitor clearance.
Inspect line reinstatement, drain, dry and preservation and sign off records.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: Diploma or Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. 
Shall have 10 years of relevant industrial experience, including 6 years’ experience as Piping - Test pack/Hydrotest Inspector.
Preferably having ASNT NDT Level II in MT, RT, PT, UT methods 
Having CSWP 3.1 or AWS CWI certification is an added advantage.
Shall have a demonstrated background and thorough knowledge of codes such as ANSI B 31.3, 31.4 and 31.8, ASME Section V and IX, AWS D1.1, required for the execution of the work.
Should have experience in oil & gas/petrochemical industry.
Should have previously worked with major EPC contractor or their sub-contractors.

Additional Information

1.         Gain experience in all aspects of workplace related practices and DP World safety standards.2.         Develop skills and build on knowledge to carry out planned maintenance on all items related to Reefer and general cooling systems.3.         To learn to provide maximum operational availability of equipment by conducting periodic diagnostic work and repairs.4.         To keep the Supervisor and other experienced technicians informed of progress & problems to ensure smooth flow of communication.5.         To maintain tidiness and cleanliness of workshop facilities/Work areas and all equipment thereby creating a safe and healthy work environment. 6.         Gain knowledge and hands on experience on how to carry out fault diagnosis on the equipment and ascertain the cause of defects, repair methods, and spare part requirements.7.         Get familiarized in the methods of being able to select the correct spare parts, and obtain technical information from the manufactures parts and technical manuals.8.         Be able to carry out the above duties with guidance and supervision of more experienced technicians and independently where applicable.9.         Start on a foundation to build on knowledge across DPW Engineering sections, inclusive of plant & crane as well as mechanical and electrical works. Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.   With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 106,500 employees from 158 nationalities, spanning 73 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.  We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses -- Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades. What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimizing disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door. We make trade flow to change what's possible for everyone.

Mentors and guides a team of commercial system officers.

A track record of successfully leading engineering teams and launching vehicles. Strong leadership, analytical, and project management skills.

Job Description:
Our client is a progressive diversified and sustainable business group in the region providing an outstanding experience in the Automotive and Associated Businesses through superior value products and services in partnership with some of the worlds leading brands. They are looking for an IT Audit Supervisor who will be responsible of the following: Duties and Responsibilities: Develop and update Continuous Auditing (CA) Implementation Strategy. Further participate in the Implementation of Continuous Auditing, through the following: Deep understanding of the underlying business processes, application systems, and data sources. Identifying critical process risks & system control points, and prioritizing areas to be addressed. Designing technology-assisted approach to test controls and identify deficiencies. Designing analytic tests to measure or flag exception-based criteria. Managing the results (tracking, reporting, monitoring, and following up) in a master file. Capitalize on the experience learned and generated results by standardizing and consolidating CA test scripts in a designated library for IA team reference and knowledge sharing. Performs general and application control reviews for information systems. Performs IT security audits to include system development standards, network, operating system, data center, Information system security (including evaluation of security vulnerabilities and mitigation procedures), programming controls and cybersecurity audits. Other reviews associated with IT policies, change management, business continuity planning, backup and disaster recovery, and system maintenance. Follows up on audit / CA findings to ensure that management has taken corrective action(s). Assists and trains other audit staff in the use of computerized audit techniques, and in developing methods for review and analysis of computerized information systems. Maintains knowledge with respect to relevant state-of-the-art technology, equipment, and/or systems. Maintain and update SAP T-codes library to be aligned with IA departmental scope of work. Requirements University Degree in Information Technology / Computer Information Systems or related domain. Certification Information Systems Auditor (CISA) is a plus. At least 6 8 years of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified. Strong ability to work effectively in a team and to communicate verbally and in writing with others. Strong analytical skills and ability to effectively prioritize and coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously. Background Knowledge in Continuous Auditing (CA)Knowledge of current technological developments/trends in area of expertise. Knowledge of auditing concepts and principles. Understanding of Information Security standards and best practices (e.g., ITIL Co BIT 2019)Understanding of Internal Audit standards and Internal Control environment.

Job Description:
Our client is a marketing communication group with regional and local expertise in all aspects of marketing communications (Public Relations, Event Management, social media, and Public Speaking). They provide holistic Marketing Services to help them achieve their preset objectives. They are looking to hire multiple PR Account Managers to join their team in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Duties & Responsibilities Manage a portfolio of clients PR accounts and be responsible for the overall quality and delivery of client programmers ensuring clients strategic goals are met. Provide strategic counsel to clients to aid their PR and wider marketing campaigns. Build relationships with existing and new clients, manage their needs and their accounts, while also providing them with innovative and creative ideas. Analyze PR coverage and provide written reports. Contribute to daily meetings and liaise/update clients on PR activities. Keep abreast of current PR trends and tools. Spearhead both traditional PR and social media projects. Develop news angles, stories and pitches to further the clients profile, products and services. Fulfill the client's key performance indicators and grow their accounts. Manage a high level of client interaction. Supervise, guide and mentor junior members of the staff. Daily client counsel, including problem solving. Develop and edit written media communications PR documents that are on message and tailored to audience; documents will include slides, proposals, plans, and issues management documents. Keep abreast of new media developments, PR trends and opportunities for both clients and the wider industry. Lead and participate in new business ventures, including pitching. Requirements Bachelor's degree in Public Relations, Business Administration or related field 5+ years of experience in a similar role, preferably with multinational agencies Prominent levels of communication - presentation, verbal, and written skills Strong copywriting and marketing mastery Solid computer prowess and project management skills Strategic thinking and innovation English and Arabic are a must.

Job Description:
 Our client is one of the fastest growing fintech start-ups providing invoice discounting services in Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, they are looking to hire an MLRO & Compliance Manager for their Riyadh office. The role holder will be a detail-oriented and empathetic leader to head up Compliance and MLRO. Duties & Responsibilities Identifying compliance risks and advising on appropriate policies, procedures, systems, and controls. Documenting the organization, responsibilities and procedures of the Firms compliance function. Ensuring compliance breaches are readily identified, reported, and acted on. Keeping senior management up to date on changes in relevant regulations and their implications. Preparing the Firm for risk assessment visits. Reviewing the Firms marketing materials. Processing applications for the registration and withdrawal of individuals. Ensuring that employees receive training on what must or must not be done to ensure compliance. Liaising with the regulator and ensuring all regulatory returns and ad hoc notifications are submitted on
time. Maintaining the Firms regulatory files and registers. Providing support and training to the groups Compliance Officer where applicable. For MLRO: Identifying money laundering risks and advising on appropriate policies, procedures, systems and controls. Overseeing the day-to-day operation of the Firms policies, procedures, systems and controls. Receiving and investigating internal Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) from employees. Reporting SARs to the Financial Intelligence Unit and to the regulator. Acting as the point of contact within the Firm for competent UAE authorities and the regulator. Overseeing compliance with UN sanctions and international, governmental and regulatory findings. Establishing and maintaining a staff awareness and training program for the prevention of money
laundering. Reporting to senior management on the quality and effectiveness of the Firms AML program. Requirements: 5+ years of Compliance experience in both Regulatory Compliance and the Financial Crime side. Previous senior Compliance Manager or MLRO responsibilities. Experience and familiarity with industry system providers and how to integrate providers into new and existing products and operational processes. In-depth and practical working knowledge of the compliance, money laundering and KYC decrees in Saudi Arabia. Experience working with international standards covering: Money Laundering Regulations, proceeds of financial crime, Bribery, Terrorism, Fraud, and other regulations impacting company's business. Previous experience in building teams and processes from scratch. Strong data, analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to deal with problems in a practical and common-sense way, consistently demonstrating sound judgment. Preferably to have professional certifications for ICA or CAMS.

About the job Senior HSEQ Trainer
Responsibilities  Provide training and assessments as needed to meet the specific needs of course participants, and employ appropriate training techniques to achieve positive learning outcomes. Aiming for >90% course participant evaluation results  Contribute to the development of industry training packages, ensuring that in-house training meets the competency and capability assessment frameworks defined by relevant industry standards and accrediting bodies' competency assessments.  Conduct course participant evaluations and determine compliance with pre-requisite criteria in accordance with key client requirements.  Assist in the development, modification, and enhancement of training materials as needed to ensure the accuracy and relevance of training Ensure that internal training meets or exceeds principles like 'ISO/IEC 17024 Conformity Assessment - General requirements for bodies operating certification of persons,' Industry Standards, and accrediting bodies competency assessments.  Provide satisfactory training reports of course participant evaluation to allow department and business unit managers to act on any areas identified for improvement or to manage the consequences of candidates deemed unsuitable for high-risk tradecraft engagement.  As needed, conduct workplace verification of competence assessments. Ensuring that course participants follow training curricula and competence regulations  Coach and mentor site management and supervisors to ensure they understand and adhere to competency and capability training needs analysis and training delivery criteria in accordance with Company HSSEQ Management Systems (e.g. HSSEQ Competency Management Procedure)  Carry out job-related responsibilities as assigned 
Authority to Make Decisions:  Autonomous authority to determine trainees' competency and capability skill to ensure compliance with Company HSSEQ Management Systems (e.g., HSSEQ Competence and Capability Procedure)  May take whatever corrective action they deem reasonable at the time to reduce risk to people, the environment, or property. About the job Offshore Team Leader (Call Center - Dispatching)
Responsibilities: Overseeing, coaching, and guiding a team of offshore call center agents, ensuring their adherence to dispatching protocols. Establishing performance goals and objectives for both the team and individual agents, focusing on efficient task dispatching. Monitoring and analyzing team performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement in dispatching processes. Providing regular feedback and coaching to team members to enhance their dispatching skills and performance. Developing comprehensive training programs and materials to enhance the team's knowledge of dispatching procedures. Ensuring the team meets or exceeds service level agreements and key performance indicators related to dispatching. Maintaining open communication channels with team members and other departments to address issues and streamline dispatching processes. Handling escalated customer complaints and resolving issues promptly, with a strong focus on efficient task dispatching. Conducting regular team meetings to review performance, share best practices, and collaboratively identify areas of improvement. Demonstrating proficiency in dispatch programs such as Perspective or other relevant dispatching software. Utilizing hands-on experience with radio dispatch equipment to optimize task allocation and communication. Exhibiting the ability to deliver results under time constraints and meet deadlines in a fast-paced dispatching environment. Previous experience in terminal operations, dispatch, or as a driver, providing valuable insights into effective dispatching practices. Qualifications: Possession of a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a related field. A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a call center environment, with proven leadership experience. Fluency in English, enabling effective communication with offshore team members. Strong leadership abilities, coupled with effective coaching and mentoring skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to facilitate seamless collaboration within the team and across departments. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment, ensuring efficient task dispatching. Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills, enabling effective resolution of dispatching challenges. Knowledge of call center software and technology, particularly as it relates to dispatching. Flexibility to work flexible hours and weekends, as required by the offshore call center operation.

job_title: Quality Assurance Executive (data analysis- internal auditing)
description:
About the job Quality Assurance Executive (data analysis- internal auditing)
Duties and Responsibilities: Responsible for calibrating, monitoring, and supporting the quality standards between internal and external parties. Create process documentation/workflows/Work instructions, knowledge articles, and self-service guidance. Collect and document business requirements for project and process improvement/automation efforts. Perform an internal audit to make sure that all departments are working by the officially agreed process. Facilitate process workflow modeling to collaborate on process improvements, automation capabilities, and clearly defined end-to-end use cases. Review information and trends to ensure that the output of processes achieves the desired results and that services meet agreed service levels. Conduct maturity assessments against the process activities to highlight areas of improvement or concerns. Identify issues and risks. Bring inconsistencies and problems to the attention of management. Participate in solving problems. Track major incidents and ensure adherence to the process and escalation of requirements within the various support and delivery areas. Extract reports and provide a high-level analysis of data for review. Participate in the planning of QA department objectives. Manage and improve the quality control process. Set goals and metrics, and report on quality control results continuously. Communicate quality concerns with stakeholders. Developing test plans and test cases to ensure that our services meet quality standards. Working with cross-functional teams to ensure that quality is built into the product development process. Investigating and resolving any quality-related issues that arise. Continuously improving the QA process to ensure that it is effective and efficient. Skills/Qualifications:2:3 years of experience in Quality Assurance Experience in internal auditing and data analysis is highly preferred. Working knowledge of tools, methods, and concepts of quality assurance. Bachelors in business administration, computer science, or a similar relevant field. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Outstanding communication and presentation skills. Critical thinker & self-motivated. Creative problem solver. Great analytical skills. Data-driven approach. Excellent in MS Office, Adobe Acrobat, and Power Point (many reports and presentations will be required)Excellent  or Fluent in English. Strong Leadership and Communication skills. Knowledge of ISO 9001:2015 & ISO 17100:2015 is preferable. Background localization & translation industry is preferable. Preference will be given to candidates who are familiar with the following courses: Data Analysis and Lean Auditing.

Job Description:
Our client is a progressive diversified and sustainable business group in the region providing an outstanding experience in the Automotive and Associated Businesses through superior value products and services in partnership with some of the worlds leading brands. They are looking for a Data Governance Manager to join their team. The Data Governance Manager will be leading the data governance team in the formation and execution of data governance framework, policies, and standards. Moreover, ensuring that data quality requirements are defined, documented, and translated into effective and consistent processes that improve the quality of data. Duties & Responsibilities Manage and embed Data Quality projects/ initiatives that will deliver tangible data quality improvement through root cause analysis, data cleansing etc.
Establish and govern an enterprise data governance implementation roadmap that is aligned with company's strategic direction.
Roll out a data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture.
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability of corporate data systems.
Ensure that the requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined, communicated, and well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planning.
Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards and data protection standards across the company.
Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles, and responsibilities.
Identify new business opportunities pertaining to the use of information assets to achieve efficiency and effectiveness in the marketplace.
Requirements Bachelors or masters in computer science, Information Systems, or other IT related field.
Minimum 5 years in a senior management role with board level change or transformation leadership experience.
Strong knowledge of industry leading data quality and data protection management practices.
Strong knowledge of data related to government regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues.
Internally and externally recognized subject matter experts that influence the way things are done.

Responsible to provide the highest possible standard of patient care under the direction of a Consultant, according to approved clinical privileges and available resources and ensure that a quality, cost effective service is provided to all patients.
 
Education:

Job Description:
Our client is a marketing and communication agency based in Saudi Arabia offering a range of services such as advertising, events and many more. They are looking to hire a Senior Account Manager for their events department in Riyadh. Responsibilities: Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, vendors, and all other parties involved in assigned events. Develop strong relationships with clients to ensure repeat business and referrals. Understand client objectives and develop creative proposals that meet or exceed expectations. Negotiate contracts with vendors and service providers to secure the best possible terms and pricing. Manage event budgets and track all expenses to ensure accuracy and adherence to budget constraints. Create detailed event timelines and schedules to ensure all deadlines are met and all logistical details are accounted for. Oversee on-site event management and execution, ensuring all elements are carried out according to plan. Advocate for user-centered design principles and contribute to a culture of design thinking and innovation within the organization. Excellent communication and presentation skills to articulate design decisions and receive feedback. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to overcome design challenges. Experience working in an Agile development environment and ability to adapt to iterative design processes.

Job Description:
Our client is an investment company, based in Kuwait, that offers asset management and investment banking solutions. They have rapidly become one of the leading asset management and investment banking institutions in the MENA Region. They are looking to hire a VP Asset Allocator to join their growing team. The ideal candidate will be managing the international investment proprietary and client portfolio including: identification of superior investment opportunities, new product development and asset allocation to maximize return and consistently meet or exceed benchmarks, and to advise current and potential clients periodically on existing and potential products. Duties & Responsibilities Direct the implementation of tactical asset allocations on a yearly basis to enhance returns against the relevant benchmark index as decided by the Bo D. Find new investment products (funds, portfolios, projects, etc.) and work closely with external partners and internally to develop products, structure portfolios for investments and continuously ensure that superior service, information and solutions are delivered to clients.  Facilitate decisions on the placement of money (country, asset class, sector etc.) in collaboration with the Investment Committee to generate maximum value. Lead the provision of wealth management expertise and professional investment advice using the best services and products available to ensure clients' financial goals are met. Advise clients on new products, manage portfolios and structure deals ensuring the interests of clients are protected at all times. Direct the preparation of a framework for the launch of all applicable funds/programs to ensure an effective mechanism of fund operations. Build a network of contacts in order to strengthen relationships with the clients in the region. Ensure timely day to day rebalancing of portfolio and periodic evaluation of manager performance. Ensure that macro research reports are developed and circulated to clients in order to position the company as a thought leader on subjects related to investment climate and opportunities. Ensure that relevant fund structure, regulatory changes and fund performance are continuously monitored and tracked in order to flag areas of concern and support decision making on any corrective actions.  Direct the research activities on new innovative products, programs, funds targeting investments in different asset classes, markets and sectors specific on a global basis as per the strategic plan and board of directors guidelines in order to support building a pipeline of products that generate more fee income. In conjunction with the functional head, formulate inputs and lead the implementation of the strategy in line with company's vision, mission and objectives. Manage the effective achievement of departmental objectives through the leadership of the department and the setting of individual objectives, recruiting qualified staff, managing performance, developing and motivating staff, provision of formal and informal feedback and appraisal in order to maximize staff and departmental performance. Support in the development of the department organization structure in order to ensure alignment with company's strategy and objectives. Ensure preparation/consolidation of budgets and monitor financial performance versus budgets, for the business to be aware of anticipated costs/revenues. Support the management of change through continuous improvement of departmental systems, processes and practices taking into account international leading practices. Develop and oversee the implementation of department policies, procedures and controls covering all areas of department activity so that all relevant procedural/legislative requirements are fulfilled while delivering a quality, cost-effective service. Ensure continuous efforts are exerted to contribute to the social environment of Kuwait society in all areas through company's CSR initiatives. Perform other related duties or assignments as directed. To be fully aware of our policies & procedures and CMA rules & regulations related to the work which are critical and can affect the work directly and indirectly. Requirements﻿﻿ Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent MBA/CFA is preferred 10 years of experience in a similar position with at least 4 years in a managerial position Ethics, compliance and professionalism Asset allocation and financial analysis Risk & financial management Engaging customers Developing talent Portfolio management

The Senior Network Security Consultant role duties involve presales activities & post Sales activities on a high technical and outstanding quality level. Presales activities cover solution presentation and proof of concept. Post sales activities include: design audit, implementation, integration and review of network- and security solutions. The primary targets are customer-satisfaction, professionalism, accuracy and outstanding high quality in the work/duties. Responsibilities Leads projects delivering architectural level requirements and supervising activities related to deployment, configuration, testing and troubleshooting. Execution of technical security projects for our clients. Act as a subject matter expert for information security services to our clients. Interaction and communication with vendor support organizations and engineers. Designing security architectures for our clients. Researching innovative solutions for client needs. Deliver a successful proof of concept for our clients. Maintain a healthy project status. Able to handle the customer demands and requests. Qualifications & Skills More than 5yrs working experience in Information Security. Bachelor’s degree in information security or IT-related matter or equivalent experience. Worked in IT consulting companies. The ability to architect, design and implement the targeted solutions is a must. Worked in large-scale organizations on customer side and/or worked in IT-vendor environment. Presentations in front of large audience.   Deep understanding of technical relations in a complex environment. High experience with the ability to implement and deliver projects of the below products plus the highest certifications required: Palo Alto firewalls, Panorama, Cortex EDRFortinet products Infoblox Any additional experience in F5, Symantec DLP, Beyond Trust will be considered as add-on. Understanding of information security concepts and related technology. Strong background and experience in TCP/IP networking of large-scale organizations including routing and switching including OSPF and BGP. Understanding of Software Defined Networks (SDN) and virtualization. Experience in cloud infrastructure such as Azure and AWS. Flexible work approach, based on the job requirements. Being able to identify new work areas and to set new goals for themselves. Very good presentation skills. Excellent and accent-free communication skills in English (Arabic an advantage). Proper and structured documentation and diagramming. Excellent organizational skills in enterprise support. Excellent communication and training skills. Outstanding customer handling, friendly and goal oriented. Ability to communicate / translate to Customer-level. Being able to understand complex business processes and activities. Flexible work approach, based on the job requirements. Being able to manage his/her own projects. Benefits Health insurance with one of the leading global providers for medical insurance Career progression and growth through challenging projects and work Employee engagement activities throughout the year Tailored training & development program Corporate discount program (hotels, restaurants…etc.)About Us Help AG is the cybersecurity arm of e& enterprise (formerly Etisalat Digital) and provides leading enterprise businesses and governments across the Middle East with strategic consultancy combined with tailored information security services and solutions that address their diverse requirements, enabling them to evolve securely with a competitive edge. Present in the Middle East since 2004, Help AG was strategically acquired by e& (formerly Etisalat Group) in Feb 2020, hence creating a cybersecurity and digital transformation powerhouse in the region. Help AG has firmly established itself as the region's trusted IT security advisor by remaining vendor-agnostic, trustworthy, independent, and cybersecurity focused. With best-of-breed technologies from industry-leading vendor partners, expertly qualified service delivery teams and a state-of-the-art consulting practice, Help AG delivers unmatched value to its customers by strengthening their cyber defences and safeguarding their business.
