description:
About the job Senior Administrative Assistant
Position Brief The Senior Administrative Assistant is responsible to compile and maintain records of business and office activities, performing a variety of duties and utilising knowledge of systems or procedure. Functional Responsibilities Co-ordinate and distribute papers and documents as appropriate Prepare correspondence and documents as instructed according to the department-established procedures Use agreed correspondence systems as required to track progress of outstanding actions/sign off and follow up Ensure both paper and electronic filing systems are developed and maintained to the standard required Book rooms and make travel arrangements or other requests as necessary for the Section Head and proactively follow up Answer phone calls and respond to queries related to Workshops generic activities or divert calls to relevant staff Receive, check, record and file all technical and non-technical documents as per established policy and procedures and keep under safe custody Input document data into required registers ensuring that the information is accurate and up to date Retrieve and record clearly on document register to whom they have been issued, date and distribute as appropriate Provide document control reports as requested, review progress and point out errors and/or delays or issues to relevant staff Liaise with subject matter experts on technical subjects to prepare controlled documents Adhere to Health and Safety policies and procedures in work and other corporate procedures and comply to any new work instructions Perform other duties / tasks as required. Qualification: Bachelors degree or higher level qualification in a relevant subject. Current/valid Qatar Driving License would be an advantage Experience: Minimum of 12 years of experience in secretarial/administration tasks Experience of working in a multidisciplinary Organization preferably in the Middle East Ability to produce Executives reports is compulsory Ability to influence and engage stakeholders and staff at all levels within the Organization Competent in Microsoft Office Packages Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English is mandatory. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in Arabic would be an advantage.

About the job Road Pavement Specialist
Road Pavement Specialist Functional Responsibilities Provide technical support on pavement materials, design, construction, maintenance and rehabilitation treatments and practical applications. Lead advanced pavement investigations in critical sites to identify causes of defects and propose appropriate repairs. Conduct advanced research, analyze data, and provide recommendations and improvements to current or proposed Clients pavement management procedures such as performance modeling, and effectiveness of pavement maintenance. Develop and implement new technologies, suitable for the road network in Qatar, for pavement evaluations and preservations. Provide technical advice on monitoring and evaluating materials and maintenance and rehabilitation treatments. Support ROMD Sections in achieving recycling targets in pavement maintenance and rehabilitation activities. Provide training and knowledge transfer to ROMD staff and partners on performance-based contracts and bets practices. Review and update current procedures, codes of practice and manuals for pavement distresses, maintenance and rehabilitation activities. Qualification: Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering or higher-level qualification in a relevant subject. Education qualification obtained from North America, West Europe, Australia Holder of Chartered Membership in relevant discipline (e.g. Engineering) would be an advantage Holder of Accreditation from known Institute would be an advantage. Holder of current/valid Qatar Driving License Experience: A minimum of 18 years related experience, including pavement engineering, pavement management and non-destructive testing of pavements. A post-graduate degree related to pavement engineering and/or management would be considered an asset. Knowledge of pavement engineering demonstrated by experience in pavement design, investigation, and research. Knowledge or experience of USA or UK pavement design methodologies Knowledge of materials behavior underlying standard specifications Construction inspection experience related to paving. Strong client management experience. Previous experience as a Project Manager, having led teams involved in pavement engineering and management. Well-developed written communication skills in the preparation of technical reports, correspondence and proposals are also important. Proficient in the use of Microsoft suite of applications (Excel, Power Point, Word)

About the job Technical Writers (OES)
Qualifications HND in Engineering or equivalent. Knowledge and/or Experience 5 years experience in a relevant process operation in LNG production including 3 years experience as a technical author in the hydrocarbon or petrochemical industry. Technical and Business Skills Expert in written and spoken English. Must be proficient in word processing, desktop publishing, project planning and scheduling, spreadsheets, flowcharts, graphics, technical drawing, and other computer-related utilities. Proficiency must include a working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and Power Point) and MS Share Point.﻿Key Job Accountabilities1. Develops required documentation for Operations plants in compliance with established Company policies and procedures, oil & gas industry and international standards, and ISO 9000 & 14000 requirements.2. Revalidates Operations Group procedures and standing instructions to ensure the continued availability of accurate, detailed, step-by-step documentation that enables the safe and efficient operation and maintenance of Company facilities.3. Reviews and revises existing plant operations documentation and proposes criticality levels for Operations procedures.4. Produces concise and accurate technical and safety related documents that reflect industry best practice and client lessons learned.5. Develops Operations and Maintenance procedure assessment packages in accordance with established Company competency assurance standards.6. Facilitates appropriate reviews and input to ensure continued development of concise and accurate technical and safety-related documentation and As-is and As-built information and instructions are reflected in relevant documentation.7. Identifies areas of improvement to enhance the capacity of Operations to mitigate business risk and meet emerging needs. Ensures technical changes are cascaded to the relevant departments to be updated in all plant documentation and related competency assessments.8. Supports the identification of operational areas that require technical changes or alterations to accommodate varying operating conditions and develops procedural solutions within Operations groups and across all relevant facilities.9. Administers the document review process to ensure that all Operations documentation reviews effectively capture the changes requested by concerned stakeholders.10. Works closely with the Graphics Officer and the Engineering Group documentation section to ensure that changes to all P&IDs are properly captured and reflected within simplified drawings.

About the job SENIOR OPERATIONS ENGINEER (OFFSHORE)
Job Description Manage the team of Operations Engineers who are responsible for well design and thereafter the operational support for all offshore wells according to agreed policies, procedures and standards to achieve the CLIENTannual drilling objectives. Review and approve the drilling programs prepared within the section to ensure they are technically correct, the optimum design has been selected and that they comply with CLIENT policies standards and procedures. Identify and mitigate risks in all offshore drilling operations through a systematic approach to hazard management with the objective to protect people, the environment and CLIENT assets and reputation. Ensure that HSE considerations are fully addressed at the well design stage by using systematic risk and hazard management technique with the clear objective to eliminate all significant accidents. Initiate change and champion best practice and new technology application to enhance well designs and operational performance to ensure fit for purpose wells at the lowest cost. Required qualifications, experience and expertise:
BSc. Engineering Degree. IWCF Certification at Supervisor level Seasoned professional with at least 20 years experience in Drilling Operations of which at least 5 years in a Senior OE position. Minimum of 5 years as an Operations Drilling Engineer with a major IOC or NOCMinimum of 2 years well site experience. Knowledge of Process Safety related to drilling Operations and a proactive mind set for managing safety. Mastery in well design, tubular design, wellbore construction, drilling fluids, well control, and a good understanding of geology. Demonstrated leadership and people management skills and a keen awareness for cultural sensitivity. Fully conversant with and ability to use all Drilling Engineering Software within EDT (Engineers Desktop) including; Compass; Well Plan; Stress Check and Casing Seat. Excellent verbal and written skills in English Ability to coach and support Qatari Development staff. Preferable Experience and Expertise
Experience with hydrogen sulphide well designs and safety practices. Knowledge of tendering and contracting procedures and practices. Experience with workover operations in high pressure gas wells Experience in working with CLIENT standard Drilling Engineering Software Open-Wells.

job_title: MP Quality Governance and Management System Lead (T-1541)-2
description:
About the job MP Quality Governance and Management System Lead (T-1541)-2
Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Project Management, or a related field Knowledge and/or Experience At least 15 years of experience in project assurance role and risk management, with experience of managing complex projects Proficient in QMS, ISO 9001, 29001, 140001, OHSAS 18001, and API Q2Knowledge of regulatory compliance in the oil and gas industry. Strong leadership skills, attention to detail, and the ability to effectively navigate complex stakeholder dynamics. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent organizational skills, with ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels Strong understanding of project management methods and project governance frameworks Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing project governance policies and procedures Experience of developing and implementing project assurance processes and procedures Strong understanding of project management tools such as Prince2 or Agile Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong Knowledge in various Quality tools, Six Sigma and lean process Demonstrated experience in Auditing Projects organizations. Certified Lead Quality Auditor is a plus Experience in the oil and gas industry is strongly preferred

About the job Control System Engineer (E&P)
Qualifications Degree in Engineering or Science majoring in Engineering in the area of specialization Knowledge and/or Experience 8 years experience in DCS, Plant Shutdown System within Oil and Gas Environment. Preferrable in Plant Operation Simulator development. Computer literate, with advanced knowledge of all relevant engineering software tools, systems and tools. Fluent in English language (demonstrated verbal and written skills). Key Job Accountabilities ﻿1.	Plan and prepare work activities during the project phase to ensure a smooth completion of planned activities. 
2.	Ensure control system engineering activities are conducted in accordance with company regulatory requirements. 
3.	Ensure that the Engineering documents are reviewed considering Safety in Operabilty / Maintainability  4.	Ensure control system engineering activities during simulator development, model acceptance test (MAT), factory acceptance test (FAT), Installation, commissioning and project close out. 
5.	Provide technical support during installation to to assure safe execution and company compliance. 
6.	Resolve engineering issues that may arise and communicate with the Project Management Team (PMT). 7.	Support other engineers in complex analyses and assignments and provides expertise to ensure completion of activities within schedule.  8.	Mentor the National Developee as per the development plan﻿

About the job Senior Application Expert [Administration]
Responsibilities Must have experience that demonstrates a strong background in application administration skills using various technologies. The candidate should have strong organizational skills, as well as the ability to multi-task and work independently and as a team player. Must have experience of Open layers, Geo Server, Bootstrap, SQL Server, Oracle, Arc GIS etc. Experience using Microsoft Office Suite, software development project management methodologies (e.g. AGILE), and design tools is required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with managers are required. Analytical and hardware/software troubleshooting skills are required. Perform lead/supervisor duties as and when assigned. Analytical and hardware/software troubleshooting skills are required. Qualification / Education BS in Computers Science or related subject Experience Minimum Overall 13 years of experience as an administrator into . Net technology and GIS Data Management applications/ tools. At least 5 years total experience with developing in multiple languages / protocols (ASP. NET, C#, VB. NET, Java Script, XML, Python, PHP, JSON, HTML5)At least 2 years experience of applications/tools for GIS Data Management. Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process. Solid experience with data modeling, business logic, and RESTful APIs.

About the job Head Project Engineer Utilities / Offsite (EPC-1) (N-1606)
Job Description Highlights: Provide project management and technical assistance to the EPC-1 Area Division Managers for Utilities and Inlet /Offsites/ He Ru#4/CO2.
Project management in general, preparation or finalization of technical notes and presentations, transverse coordination with the EPC-1 Project Management Leadership Team, interface coordination and reporting for engineering, procurement, construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning, handover and completion.
Excellent written and spoken English skills.
Strong technical and analytical skills.
Good planning and organisational skills.
Good influencing and negotiation skills.
Computer literacy involving the regular use of professional office and technical applications.
Think out of the box approach technical skills required to successfully perform the role.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Bachelors Degree in engineering generalist engineer also acceptable. 
Minimum 10 years of experience in multicultural project execution related environment within the oil and gas industry (LNG would be a plus) with proven knowledge and experience of project management, detailed engineering, interfaces management, project controls and planning, construction and commissioning.

About the job Telecommunications
Senior ITS Engineer - Telecommunications Jobs in Brief: Monitor and support the Road Management Centre (RMC) systems necessary to ensure secure and reliable 24/7 ITS communications to deliver the performance and availability service levels required for ITS operations Review and witness ITS project commissioning to ensure the telecommunications elements fully meet the Client ITS specifications and telecommunications strategy requirements Perform required activities associated with projects and existing ITS assets (investigation, analysis and design) to support effective programme delivery and maintaining the integrity of the Client ITS telecommunications network Review and analyse the day-to-day management and performance of the ITS telecommunications maintenance & operations contractor to ensure the availability and performance targets for the network are being met and that best practices are being followed Monitor the preventive maintenance activities of the ITS telecommunications maintenance & operations contractor to ensure that secondary and contingency measures are available and will work should any equipment fail across the network Understand detailed plans, specifications and estimates for roadway Intelligent Traffic System implementation projects and advise on suitability of proposed telecommunications design and configuration Prepare and register all relevant documentation and design reports and ensuring that all documentation is accurate and received within the system held by Client. Work in collaboration with other disciplines to ensure the integrity of the overall design of projects and ensure as-built drawings and data sheets are accurate and complete. Contribute to the resolution of technical issues, such as substandard products, on projects and providing technical guidance to other team members Maintain on-going communication with relevant stakeholders and sub-contractors to build relationships and communication networks ensuring quality of service. Carry out site visits and survey inspections and supervise Client sub-contractors Conduct studies on the requirement of Telecommunication and Network for ITS/ Tunnels. Identify key trends and provide suggestions for improving ITS/ Tunnels telecommunications efficiency and performance Identify any gaps in Telecommunication and Network ITS assets within the main corridors of Qatar and propose the most cost effective way of filling those gaps Undertake any work of a technical nature that falls within ability and competence to provide a solution to engineering problems and lead the telecommunications input in to any troubleshooting triage activities for RMC faults Work under minimum supervision and competent to check the work of others and supervise less experienced or junior staff Keep up to date with industry best practice and apply best practice to ensure professional development Adhere to Health and Safety policy and procedures and comply with new work instructions Perform other duties / tasks as required Provide input into the reviewing and updating of the I&EMP as appropriate. Ensure adherence to Health and Safety Policy and Procedures and comply with any new work instructions Qualification: Minimum Bachelors Degree in Engineering/ Relevant Subject Education qualification obtained from North America, West Europe, Australia Chartered Membership in Engineering or Relevant professional body would be an advantage Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Education qualifications or equivalent for Telemetry, Network Hardware and software Education qualification Current/valid Qatar Driving License would be an advantage Experience: Minimum of 15 years cumulative experience in a relevant field. Minimum of 8 years experience in specialist area including experience in deploying and managing Wide Area Networks and Local Area Networks Ability to establish strong working relationships with stakeholders Ability to influence and engage stakeholders and staff at all levels within the organization Competent in Microsoft Office Packages and Network Management Systems Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English is essential Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in Arabic is preferred

Job Description:
Our prestigious client, a renowned event management entity based in Riyadh, has embarked on a transformative journey, having secured a 5-year contract to manage international events for their local clientele. As they pave the way for world-class experiences, they are actively recruiting for an Event Project Manager to ensure impeccable execution and unparalleled experiences. Duties and Responsibilities: Lead the planning and execution of large-scale international events. Coordinate with clients to define event objectives and requirements. Develop detailed event project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation. Oversee cross-functional teams, ensuring tasks are completed on time and within budget. Liaise with international stakeholders, understanding their needs and ensuring local adaptability. Monitor event activities, ensuring the client's specifications are met. Resolve any arising issues or challenges promptly. Post-event, gather feedback and generate reports on event performance. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Event Management, Business, or related field.7+ years of experience in event management, with a focus on international events. Strong leadership and project management skills. Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills. Proficiency in event management software.

About the job Lead of Process/Utilities (F-4212-Q)
Job Description Highlights: Provide Process Engineering subject matter expertise during Detailed Design /EPC phases of the COMP2 project. Leads the process engineering discipline activities for the assigned project (greenfield and brownfield scope). Ensures that technical requirements (e.g. basis of design, simulations, reports, studies project specifications, data sheets, etc.) developed during FEED fully comply with project requirements. Provides Process Engineering direction, guidance and leadership to NFPS COMP2 PMT and CONTRACTOR(s) for work within the assigned area. Develop fit-for-purpose process /technical engineering definition of surface facilities. Effectively collaborates and interfaces with Project team, Contractor, Client stakeholders (Operations, OES, E&P and etc.) as required to ensure that the Topsides and facilities scope of supply is fully integrated and optimized. Provides oversight of the EPC Contractor team and timely review and approval of project deliverables within project budget and schedule. Technical evaluations of multiple EPC tenders for large, capital projects, including risk based evaluation of complex technical issues, which may have a significant commercial impact on project execution, ensuring they are compliant, technically qualified, and consistent with project requirements. Contribute to the development of Qatari employees.
Bachelors or Masters Degree in Chemical/Process engineering
15 years experience

job_title: Lead of Quality BGD - Lean Gas Lines (N-1961)-2
description:
About the job Lead of Quality BGD - Lean Gas Lines (N-1961)-2
Job Description Highlights: The Onshore Lead of Quality BGD - Lean Gas Lines is responsible to oversee the implementation of the Quality Program and verify that all Quality and Non-Destructive Examination (NDE) procedures are established in accordance with project requirements. Perform as Quality Lead for BGD welding engineer for the review Contractor deliverables including Welding Procedure Specifications (WPSs) and Procedure Quality Records (PQRs). 
Experience with multi-national contractors, in particular those involved in the construction of LNG production facilities, 
Assertive Quality management leadership skills. Must be capable of communicating Quality and Welding requirements, results and status throughout Company and contractor management and craft labour levels. 
Considerable relevant experience in the construction of onshore Oil & Gas installations. Demonstrated sound technical knowledge and extensive experience in welding processes. Expert knowledge in welding of high strength steels and corrosion resistant alloys (CRA) used in oil and gas industry. 
Fully conversant with international codes and standards used in oil and gas industry. Well experienced in NDE methods, especially, AUT & RT, specifically intermediate RT on clad materials. Validation of AUT & RT. 
Mechanical testing including corrosion and pitting tests. Strong preference given to candidates with prior Qatar Gas or IOC project experiences.
Degree in Metallurgical/Welding Engineering (or Mechanical Engineering with Welding Engineering). 
15 years experience associated with Welding Quality Control & coordination of Welding activities within the Oil & Gas Construction Industry.
Qualifications in Auditing, Welding & Materials fields are desirable.
NDT Level-II (RT, UT, PT, MT, AUT), and welding professional qualification (CSWIP, EWE, IWE or AWS) (where equivalent is proposed, evidence of equivalence shall be provided).

job_title: Lead of Security and Emergency Response (S-1521) - 3
description:
About the job Lead of Security and Emergency Response (S-1521) - 3
Qualifications Emergency Response related degree /diploma; or 20 years experience in lieu of degree. FEMA Professional Development training suite or equivalent. Tap Root® Advanced Root Cause Analysis training or equivalent. Knowledge and/or Experience Minimum of fifteen (15) years industry relevant HSE experience. International project experience with Tier-1 EPC Contractors or Client, involved in the construction of onshore production facilities (i.e. greenfield and brownfield work). Sound knowledge of the project execution process in large-scale project environments (expenditure >US$ 1 Bn).

job_title: SR PLANNING AND BUSINESS SUPPORT SPECIALIST
description:
About the job SR PLANNING AND BUSINESS SUPPORT SPECIALIST
Primary Purpose of the Job
Prepares the Subsurface (VU) Directorate business planning process. Supports all VU functions on KPIs and performance monitoring and reporting. CLIENTAudit liaison for VU Directorate. Supports VU Directorate RMR with Quality Management System processes. Principal Accountabilities
Adheres to and implements the Company's occupational safety and health and environment policy effectively in all of his/her work Works closely with all asset heads and function leaders to ensures timely preparation of various documents, data and reports necessary to obtain management and shareholders' approval of proposals and activities including business plans, operating plans and work program and budget Develops the yearly oil & gas wide business plan in collaboration with all functions and teams Gathers input and analyses data, and coordinate with management teams and other functional departments to prepare single year work programs & budgets and subsequent periodic outlook projection (Quarterly, monthly etc.)Co-ordinates the timely and quality input of the Department and International Assets information into all necessary CLIENTinternal and external reporting requirements biweekly reports, monthly reports, annual reports, etc)Provides an oversight to management of the companys strategic planning, financial forecasting, annual budgeting process, and operating plan variance analysis Provides in-depth analysis and presents findings on key drivers of monthly outlook variances Analyzes and monitors KPIs, highlighting trends and variances Develops and executes processes to allow for routine analytical reviews of company financial and operational performance, leveraging business unit analytical resources and tools Routinely communicates business unit consolidated financial and operational performance trends, historical and forecasted, using appropriate metrics. Determines trends, resulting operational and strategic implications, and key recommended actions Works closely with Corporate HSE and asset heads to incorporate Subsurface Directorate owned assets HSE performance into corporate reporting Works closely with Corporate Risk Management function and asset heads to include VU Directorate risksinto CLIENTrisk reports and suggests mitigation actions in coordination with asset heads Preparation of presentation materials for executive management and Board of Director meetings as requested Supports the Department RMR on Quality Management System processes and compliance Ensures all field audit work are adequately prepared and timely delivery of all requests from the auditors Decision Making Authority
Closely communicates and interacts with Contracts, Legal and Finance on contracting matters and provides recommendation to assets and function heads and management team Custodian for VU Directorate business plan and Work Program and Budget input and deliverables Context / Special Features / Challenges:
Works independently guided by functional objectives Manages activities by setting and controlling specialized professional standards Regular contacts with Contracts and Procurement, Finance and Legal on contracting matters Close coordination of work program and budget delivery within the Department as well as the VU Planning focal point Qualifications / Knowledge / Skills / Experience:
Minimum Qualifications: BSc/Bachelor Degree in Engineering or other Business related fields Postgraduate Degree and commercial and business training or certification will be an advantage Minimum 10 years of relevant Oil & Gas experience Job-Specific Skills:
Planning and organizational skills Business processes and contracting skills Negotiation and problem solving skills Excellent command of English language and communication skills Excellent command of computer skills

Job Description:
Our client is a premier event management company based in Riyadh. Their services include planning and organizing exhibitions, Gala dinners, conferences, summits, corporate events, fund raisers, product launches, networking events and festivals. They are seeking a skilled RFP Specialist to join their team in Riyadh. Job Brief: As an RFP Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in responding to RFPs and managing the proposal process for event-related projects. Your expertise in events management will be instrumental in crafting compelling and well-structured proposals that showcase our capabilities and services. Tasks and Duties: RFP Response: Receive and review incoming RFPs related to event management services. Analyze the requirements and scope of each RFP to understand client needs. Proposal Development: Develop customized and compelling proposals tailored to each RFP's requirements. Ensure proposals align with the company's event management capabilities and value propositions. Content Creation: Create well-written and persuasive content that showcases our events management expertise. Utilize case studies, success stories, and statistics to substantiate proposal claims. Collaboration and Coordination: Collaborate with sales, marketing, and event management teams to gather relevant information for proposals. Coordinate input and contributions from various departments to ensure a cohesive proposal. Proposal Formatting: Organize and format proposals to enhance readability and visual appeal. Utilize branding guidelines and templates for consistent presentation. Deadline Management: Ensure timely completion of proposals to meet RFP submission deadlines. Plan and prioritize tasks to manage multiple proposals simultaneously. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): Proposal Success Rate: Measure the percentage of successful proposals that lead to project awards. Proposal Quality: Evaluation of the overall quality and effectiveness of submitted proposals. Proposal Timeliness: Percentage of proposals submitted within the specified deadline. Client Feedback: Gather feedback from clients on the quality and relevance of proposals. Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Events Management, Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience in events management and a track record of successful event planning and execution. Previous experience in responding to RFPs and crafting winning proposals is a strong advantage. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a keen eye for detail. Strong project management and organizational abilities to manage multiple RFPs simultaneously. Collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Familiarity with event industry standards and practices. Creative thinking and the ability to tailor proposals to specific client needs. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and proposal management tools. Time management skills to meet tight proposal deadlines.

The Security Consultant is responsible for the proper and accurate handling of support requests for Help AG’s customers. The security consultant will receive requests by email/calls and handle those according to Help AG’s support workflow including. Continuous communication with the customer on tickets, health check, projects, and other technical work. Based on the business requirement, security consultant will be required to work as resident engineer at customer site. Proper and accurate use of tools (ticket system, time tracking) and documentation of the tickets. Follow-up on any escalations meeting SLA. Attend technical training and achieve certification as part of career development. Additionally, security consultant is expected to work on projects, POC and documentation. The primary targets are customer-satisfaction, professionalism, accuracy, and an outstanding high quality in the work/duties. Responsibilities Work on technical support tickets from customers. Perform health check for the supported technologies. Work on projects and pre-sales activity as and when required. Keep ticket-system up to date to meet SLA requirement. Interaction and communication with vendor support organizations and engineers. Qualifications and Skills More than 5 years of working experience in technical Information Security. Experience of working in an enterprise environment handling technical support, projects. Bachelor’s degree in information security or IT-related matter or equivalent experience. Deep understanding of technical relations in a complex environment. An advantage to have experience and the highest certifications of the vendors F5 Networks, Broadcom, Palo Alto firewall, Pulse Secure, OPSWAT, Infoblox, Ixia, and Fortinet technologies. Excellent and accent-free communication skills in English (Arabic would be an advantage). Proper and structured documentation and diagramming. Excellent organizational skills in enterprise support. Understanding of information security concepts and related technologies. Strong background and experience in TCP/IP networking of large-scale organizations. Flexible work approach, based on the job requirements. Being able to identify new work areas and to set new goals for themselves. Excellent communication and training skills. Outstanding customer handling, friendly and goal-oriented. Being able to understand complex business processes and activities. Benefits Health insurance with one of the leading global providers for medical insurance Career progression and growth through challenging projects and work Employee engagement activities throughout the year Tailored training & development program Corporate discount program (hotels, restaurants…etc.)About Us Help AG is the cybersecurity arm of e& enterprise (formerly Etisalat Digital) and provides leading enterprise businesses across the Middle East with strategic consultancy combined with tailored information security solutions and services that address their diverse requirements, enabling them to evolve securely with a competitive edge. Present in the Middle East since 2004, Help AG was strategically acquired by e& (formerly Etisalat Group) in 2020, hence creating a cybersecurity and digital transformation powerhouse in the region. Help AG has firmly established itself as the region's trusted IT security advisor by remaining vendor-agnostic, trustworthy, independent, and maintaining its focus on all aspects of cybersecurity. With best of breed technologies from industry-leading vendor partners, expertly qualified service delivery teams and a state-of-the-art consulting practice, Help AG delivers unmatched value to its customers by strengthening their cyber defenses and safeguarding their business.

job_title: Senior SAP Security and GRC Consultant
description:
About the job Senior SAP Security and GRC Consultant
Job Description We are looking for a Senior SAP Security & GRC Consultant having Functional, Technical, S/4 Upgrade and troubleshooting experience with strong knowledge of ERP processes and Information Security principles, critical thinking, and great communication skills. The ideal applicant will have the following experience: At least 4 full cycle SAP Implementations including Implementation in the Oil & Gas industry and at least 2 S/4HANA upgrades. Deep knowledge of various aspects of SAP Security, both from a technical as well as business process perspective. Knowledge of SAP authorization concept for both on-premises systems such as ECC, BW, MDG, S/4 HANA, Fiori roles, HANA DB, BTP etc. and new SAP Cloud solutions. Knowledge of HANA Database roles, privileges and schemas using HANA studio. Excellent knowledge of S/4HANA migrations and system transformation including business process reengineering. Familiarity with SAP Enterprise Threat Detection (ETD) Experience in designing, configuring and Implementing SAP GRC Access Request Analysis (ARA), Access Request Management (ARM), Emergency Access Management (EAM) Experience in building SOD ruleset, configuring ruleset in SAP GRC 12.0 systems and full understanding of user/role level risk analysis. Should participate in process Improvement and procedures including but not limited to change controls, project management methodology Excellent written, Interpersonal and communication skills.

About the job Applications Development Consultant (. NET)
Job Purpose: Will be responsible for designing, executing, assessing, and troubleshooting software programs and applications which include: configuring, analyzing, designing, coding, developing, unit testing and documenting software specifications throughout the project life cycle. This responsibility will extend to contributing in the estimates of projects, the quality and timeliness of the deliverables and the projects compliance to the organizational processes and standards.﻿Tasks and duties: Developing front end and back end applications and/or systems. Designing and developing APIs. Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones. Troubleshooting issues in the product (application and data), database server, web server(IIS), and networks, to minimize the risk of disruptions. Ensuring reviews are fully documented and actions are raised and fulfilled Being involved in changes to the service operation tools, processes, and working practices. Coordinating with Product Development and Implementation teams to support product updates. Create security and data protection settings. Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design. Develop, test, and maintain web and web service applications built on open-source technologies. Work closely with the Development team on analysis, requirements gathering and reporting project status. Design, develop, and test applications in accordance with established standards. Prepare reports on the status, operation and maintenance of the software. Participle in any related solution reviews and design codes. Develop and tune integrations between applications. Analyze and resolve technical and application problems. Ensure adherence to our internal procedures regarding Quality, Security, Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, and Service Level Management. Provide end-to-end support/operations service to clients through investigation, diagnosis, and fix preparation. To provide the client means to resolve tickets and to provide information and knowledge about the solution. Develop scripts for data rectification for data-related issues cause by a bug in the modules. Find root causes through problem investigation and management to reduce incidents and increase customer satisfaction. Adapt to different processes managing change lifecycle end to end in order to address clients demands and requests as fast as possible.﻿Perform health checks on the application level. Qualifications and skills: Bachelors degree in computer science or computer engineering. Minimum 5 Years of proven work experience, preferably within a technology organization as both a hands-on architect and/or a software engineer. Proven experience as a . NET Developer. Undertaking continuous improvement in the operation. Strong experience and in-depth knowledge of . NET, ASP. NET Core, ASP. NET Razor, ASP. NET MVC, C#. NET, MS SQL Server Strong experience in software Design Patterns (OOP, ), architecture style (SOA, REST, APIs) and architectural patterns (MVC, ) Solid knowledge and experience in Java Script, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap. Strong Experience with Web Services, WCF, OData, Web API Experience with . NET (Entity Framework) Experience with No SQL databases (Mongo DB, ) is preferable Experience in any one of the modern Java Script frameworks (React.js, Angular.js, Vue.js, ...) Experience with development source control (Git Hub, TFS, ) and CI/CD (Dev Ops, Git Hub Actions) Azure App Services, and Azure Functions are preferable. Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and Agile methodologies. Excellent command of English language. Very good analytical, creative problem-solving skills and have a keen eye for quality and details. Fair knowledge of Phyton, AI, machine learning concepts is preferable. Good knowledge of Docker or Kubernetes is preferable. Able to write a clean/high-quality code. Experience in SSO. Hands-on unit testing. Good understanding of security and scalability issues. Experience with complex client-side data flows, consuming APIs and JSON. Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work. kendo-UI (Telerik component) is preferable. Mobile development is preferable. Reporting Tools (like: SSRS, Telerik Reporting, Crystal Report,) is preferable. Web Security Standard knowledge (OWASP) is preferable.

About the job Lead of Telecom (F-1307, F-1306, F-1288) - 3
Job Description Highlights: Leads telecoms activities for North Field Production Sustainability (NFPS) Projects, ensuring EPC Contractor and Telecom System Integrator (TSI) deliver the project that is in compliance with the Project and Cyber Security requirements, provide secure interfaces with third party systems and ensuring that all Telecom systems are in compliance with the industrial Codes and Standards. 
Bachelor's degree in Engineering 
10 years experience working in telecoms, in large Oil & Gas Facilities having broad knowledge of engineering execution including design standards, specifications, codes, safety criteria, onshore and offshore facilities design, construction and operations. 
Conversant with relevant Telecommunications national and international standards and has a broad understanding of all aspects of Telecommunications systems and a deep understanding of own speciality(ies). 
Proven track record of delivering a portfolio of Telecom EPC projects including complex and multiple vendor projects within international settings. 
Requires hands on expertise and design experience with telecoms equipment and systems design (OTN, UHF TETRA VHF radio Systems, IP Networks), security (access control, CCTV surveillance networks, fence intruder detection, ANPR), public/emergency announcement (PAGA), and networks (WANs, LANs, Industrial Wireless Networks Wiring, Routers, Switches, Servers etc), ship/shore communication systems, Hazardous area requirements (EExd, EEi, EExe). 
Shall be proficient in fibre optic cabling network design, copper cable networks and relevant infrastructure such as duct banks, cable / ladder tray designs. This shall include transition of design engineering to construction deliverables.

About the job ICSS Lead Utilities EPC-1
Job Description Highlights: The role is at RLIC site and is responsible to lead Integrated Control and Safety Systems (ICSS) Pre commissioning and Commissioning (PC&C) activities for Onshore Project EPC scopes consisting of Inlets, offsites, CO2, LNG Process and Utilities areas. Provide leadership, support contractors in completions and handover of ICSS scopes by fully complying with project deliverables, project and international standards and standardized processes. Providing clear guidance and facilitate resolution to issues to complete ICSS handover activities by coordinating with Field Engineering, construction, and PC&C Contractor.
Bachelor Degree in Instrument Engineering or equivalent
15 years experience working in Instrument and Controls, in a Major Oil and Gas Project with broad knowledge of Honeywell experion Control system engineering and field execution including design standards, specifications, codes, Cyber Security criteria, construction and operations. 
Previous knowledge of Smart Junction Box or similar Technologies preferred.
Requires demonstrated broad Instruments & Controls equipment and Honeywell systems experience (DCS & SIS, HIPPS, PMS, IAMS, Fire & Gas, System Virtualization, BN system 1 Network) and familiarity with relevant interface requirements and relevant industry codes. 
Field commissioning experience desirable.

job_title: Lead of Internal Project Interfaces Shared Resources (F-1298-Q)-3
description:
About the job Lead of Internal Project Interfaces Shared Resources (F-1298-Q)-3
Job Description Highlights: Identify, develop, coordinate, expedite and steward closure of NFPS Compression EPCs (EPC-1/2/3/4/5/6/7/8/9) with initial focus on EPC 1/2/3/8a & 9 in term of Contract Interfaces. Assist Head of Project Interface with respect to the Commercial and Physical interfaces applicable to 9 Compression EPC Contracts and close coordination with the Interface & System Completion Division Manager. Ensures activities (including approvals) and interfaces with all internal and external parties are undertaken in accordance with Projects needs in general, and compatible with Project schedule and cost objectives to avoid delays, change orders and claims. Represent the interests of the NFPS Compression EPCs by attending to all important meetings, including ensuring comprehensive and fully documented actions list and minutes of meeting are prepared and signed by the Parties involved. Support and provide guidance to NFPS EPCs PMT team for interface matters related to the 9 EPCs including assist in resolution of technical issues. Bachelor of Science in Engineering with proven project management and execution experience specifically extensive knowledge of procedures, rules & regulation of Qatar will be added advantage Minimum of fifteen (15) years of experience in the oil and gas industry and preferably offshore project related with a minimum of 5 years in a management position. Proven experience as Discipline Engineer, Project Engineer, Interface Engineer and Interface Head. Excellent oral and written English skills. Able to write Technical reports in English. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong leadership skills

About the job TPC Operator
TPC Operator Jobs in Brief: Ensure all claims/issues are captured in the systems. Update the source systems namely Enterprise Asset Management System (EAMS)/ Customer Relationship Management System (CRMS) as required. Ensure all work assigned is completed within the agreed KPI/SLAUnderstand claims issues and requirements and process all Claims Requests in a timely manner, ensuring KPI/SLA are met. Escalate any potential workflow issues to the TPC Team Leader in a timely manner. Maintain awareness of recurring problems on the Roads network and geographical boundaries and alert/escalate to the Team Lead and immediate manager for their onward actions. Identify issues which prevent smooth processing of claims requests (Client public and vice versa) and suggest ideas for resolution Liaise with Insurance company adjusters and stakeholders throughout Client where appropriate, using various channels of communication, to ensure Client interests are protected. Act as an ambassador for Client and deal with customers in a professional and courteous manner always Cover for and/or assist other colleagues where required and according to business need. Adhere to Health and Safety policies and procedures in work and other corporate procedures and comply with any new work instructions. Perform other duties/ tasks as required. Including accident location inspection. Qualification: Diploma in relevant subject or above Physically fit to enter and work in confined spaces and the ability to undertake competency assessment to level required (essential)Able to understand the report from Insurance adjusters. Current/valid Qatar Driving License would be an advantage Experience: Minimum of 6 years work experience in a similar position In depth knowledge of Insurance claims and complaints registration. Knowledge of Maximo EAMS or equivalent system with regard to operation, system administration and training Knowledge of CRMS or equivalent system with regard to operation, system administration and training Knowledge of Microsoft Office Packages and in particular Microsoft Excel 2010Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English is essential. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in Arabic is preferred

About the job Lead of Planning COMP1/3 (F-1210-Q)

This includes development, maintenance, monitoring, controlling and integration of the EPC schedule(s) including verification and reporting in addition to ensuring that all activities comply with standardized processes and are delivered to the highest possible standards.

About the job Senior Structural Engineer
Senior Road Engineer Senior Structural Engineer Jobs in Brief: Understand the Road Operation and Management Department scope task and target. Coordinate with stakeholders for executing operations and maintenance of road networks in coordination with the Management Consultants (MC)/ contractors. Plan and program road repair works on the networks Monitor stakeholders work schedules, set priorities, and ensure the appropriate assignment of equipment, materials, and personnel. Administer, prioritize and oversee major repairs on the road network, oversee assignment maintenance crews to repair networks. Ability to undertake supervisory and inspection ( for contract compliance) tasks as assigned by Lead Engineers Work proactively with the RMD and design consultants to resolve any design related issues. Prioritize projects and assign work to outsourced maintenance crews to repair road networks, taking into consideration criticality of work to be executed. Ensure that incidents / emergencies reported are attended to and resolved by the maintenance contractors or in-house teams Perform emergency road maintenance and respond to public complaints and requests/ calls received from Customer Contact Centre / Road Management Centre Prepare all specifications for maintenance vehicles and equipment and assists in the purchase of motor vehicles, off road equipment and others, as required. Assist the project team in ensuring that road upgrading, and maintenance works are carried out to the specified technical standards and that corrective action is taken as needed. Develop the quarterly, annual and long-term preventative and routine maintenance plans to ensure that the road networks perform to the specified level of operations based on asset management standards and recommendations Coordinate with the Design Department to develop and implement improvements to existing road networks. Manage the performance of maintenance contractors to ensure adherence to defined SLAs Raise any issues that require consideration to the road networks Engineering Advisor / Expert for advice on actions/ recommendations. Ensure adherence to Health and Safety Policy and Procedures within the section and comply with any new work instructions. Perform other duties/ tasks as required Ability to write project scope of works (tendering/quotation purposes) for new and maintenance works Qualification: Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering or relevant Subject Education qualification obtained from North America, West Europe, Australia Holder of Chartered Membership in relevant discipline (e.g. Engineering) would be an advantage Holder of current/valid Qatar Driving License would be an advantage Experience: Minimum 15 years cumulative experience of road networks including 8 years managing contractors and leading a team Experience of working in a multidisciplinary Organization preferably in the Middle East Knowledge and experience in contract management Knowledge of Bridges, Tunnels, Road works, Environment policies, procedures, and regulations. Ability to deliver and support change Competent in Microsoft Office Packages Microsoft Project/Primavera Ability to influence and engage stakeholders and staff at all levels within the Organization Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English is mandatory. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in Arabic is preferred

job_title: Lead of Electrical Offplots Shared Resource (N-2731-1)
description:
About the job Lead of Electrical Offplots Shared Resource (N-2731-1)
Job Description Highlights: Responsible for overseeing Electrical Engineering activities in Offplots scope for NFE Onshore LNG Project.
Ensure all technical requirements such as project specifications, data sheets, etc. are in full compliance with project requirements, standardised processes, and delivered to the highest technical quality standards. 
Ensure all technical activities associated with the electrical engineering discipline by the EPC contractor and third parties are executed to NFE Projects specifications and Client LNG requirements.
Coordinate with Quality and Document Control department to setup a distribution matrix and provide training on review of FRB Books. Estimated around 34,000 Binders.
Lead electrical engineering design and planning activities and ensures EPC contractor develops detailed design in accordance with local regulatory requirements, industry standards, project specifications and any approved variations.
Familiar with broad Electrical equipment and systems experience (HV/MV/LV electrical systems design, power system study & relay protection coordination, Power Management Systems (PMS), Electrical Integrated Controls System (ELICS) and large Motors (10MW+), Cathodic Protection, Emergency Generation and Distribution System, Lighting and Small Power distribution and familiarity with relevant manufacturing processes and relevant industry codes.
Strong skills in English communication, technical and discipline management, influencing, interface skill and proficient in Microsoft Office suite programs. 
Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
Minimum 10 years experience of Electrical Engineering, preferably in a major LNG Projects. Broad knowledge of engineering execution including design standards, specifications, codes, safety criteria.
About the job Senior Engineer (IT)

About the job Senior Application Analyst
Responsibilities Identifying organizational need for new applications Preparing technical specification as a roadmap for software Implementing, testing and integrating new applications Performing routine application backups and upgrades Installing new applications upgrade and releases Providing instructions and training to staff when necessary Monitoring, recoding and responding to requests for support Investigating and diagnosing system faults and errors Resolving technical issues Analyzing error trends aimed at reducing/minimizing down time Communicating messages regarding application issues to users in a timely manner Liaising with application suppliers when needed to fulfil the requirements of the organization Scheduling and running regular tests to enhance the current application. Identifying and developing functionality changes Maintaining documentation of key databases and applications linked to them. Perform lead/supervisor duties as and when assigned. Analysis/options or feasibility research of needs and possible solutions. Visually map solution and present in an easy-to-understand manner to get a decision. Identify technology and/or business requirements. Gather, document and update business requirements. Complete detailed workflow process mapping. Develop testing strategies and execute test plan to mitigate deployment risk. Qualification/ Education BS in Computers Science or related subject Knowledge of SQL, SAS Visual Analytics, SSRS, or other reporting technology Exposure to and understanding of work structure/operations. Experience Overall 10+ years of experience; Minimum of 5 years experience in following areas: Administration, monitoring and maintenance of software infrastructures and applications. Oversee practices and processes to ensure integrity, safety and availability of all data and applications as part of organizations information systems. Ensure that the processes needed for a business to function and succeed are running smoothly. Technical point of contact to fix application and systems issues, usually on an immediate basis.

About the job DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER
Job Description
The position report to Dukhan Redevelopment Team Leader. Manage Project Initiation, Feasibility & Early Concept Optimization Studies for Dukhan development projects Work with Onshore Development, Project Engineering & Operations on Studies strategies & plans. Develop and manage the schedule & cost. Manage contracts (including changes and variations) for the Studies Manage review & finalization of Study deliverables. Manage and communicate performance, implement lessons learnt & participate in audits and reviews. Manage transition of projects during and after Studies to Project Engineering. Support engineering definition, operational requirements and philosophies into the project, construction activities, operational readiness and assurance process including commissioning and start-up, handover, and close outs. Identify threats, opportunities, and constraints to the projects, and evaluate risk mitigations Identify and evaluate new technologies. Support pilot projects
Required Qualifications, Experience and Expertise: Bachelor's degree or higher in Mechanical, Chemical or Petroleum Engineering,15+ years of direct experience in engineering, project management and execution of oil & gas projects Experience in typical upstream facility mechanical/process design principles such as multiphase flow, separator/ pump/compressor capacity evaluation, pipe/valve sizing, hydraulic analysis, etc. Knowledge of process engineering, hydraulic modelling and supporting software Well-developed planning and organization skills, including the ability to work independently, prioritize activities, meet deadlines, and actively manage time in a dynamic work environment

Job Description:
Our client is one of the fastest growing fintech providing invoice discounting services in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and they are looking to hire a Senior Legal Manager for their Riyadh office. In addition to supply chain finance, our client will soon start offering B2B Buy Now, Pay Later, which would be the first of its kind offering in the region. The candidate should be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with broad, generalist responsibilities, but with specialist legal subject skills in commercial law and regulatory matters pertaining to the financial sector. Duties and Responsibilities Give accurate and timely counsel to executives in a variety of legal topics (labor law, partnerships, international ventures, corporate finance etc.)Collaborate with management to devise efficient defense strategies Specify internal governance policies and regularly monitor compliance Research and evaluate different risk factors regarding business decisions and operations Apply effective risk management techniques and offer proactive advise on possible legal issues Communicate and negotiate with external parties (regulators, external counsel, public authority etc.), creating relations of trust Draft and Review agreements, contracts and other legal documents to ensure the companys full legal rights Deal with complex matters with multiple stakeholders and forces Provide clarification on legal language or specifications to everyone in the organization Conduct your work with integrity and responsibility Maintain current knowledge of alterations in legislation Able to liaise with SAMA and other agencies on licensing requirements and documentation. Requirements5-8 years' experience in Corporate Law Have worked at least 6 years in a medium to large sized companies Proven experience as a Legal Manager in business environment Excellent knowledge and understanding of corporate law and procedures Full comprehension of the influences of the external environment of a corporation High degree of professional ethics and integrity Excellent communication skills (English is a MUST)BSc degree in Law or J. D. degree Previous experience in financial institutions or liaison with SAMA will be a big plus

Job Description:
Our client is a progressive diversified and sustainable business group in the region providing an outstanding experience in the Automotive and Associated Businesses through superior value products and services in partnership with some of the world's leading brands. They are looking for a Network Admin Support Lead to join their team. The Network Admin Support Lead is responsible to manage the network support team in order to ensure the delivery of all the company's network and server system services to the users to sustain the business operation by overseeing, planning, and designing the strategies & coordinating with other team members (supervisor, manager) to align it in one common direction. Duties & Responsibilities Design, develop, install, configure, and maintain network operating system software and network infrastructure applications. Maintain software installation libraries, monitor directories and domains and audit server logs to identify performance issues and device failures. Install server fixes and service packs to maintain reliability and security. Troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve server connectivity and performance issues, administer network standards including naming conventions and address protocols. Monitor, analyze and manage network traffic and other conditions to achieve optimal performance and uptime by analyzing data to minimize network congestion. Manage network support management team and coordinate with other IT team members to provide the network/server system services for business use. Define the KPIs of team members, evaluate resources and allocate tasks. Coordinate with data resource team and technical support team for optimizing the support service to users. Ensure the administration, backup/recovery, performance, and security of network/server system to comply service level agreement with the users. Maintain state-of-the-art computer room and peripherals. Analyze network capacity and growth requirements and recommend network infrastructure upgrades and enhancements to meet long-term the company needs. Develops plans for server room expansion including rack space, floor space, cooling and power requirements & installation of server racks, uninterruptible power supplies and other server support equipment. Develop specifications for network hardware, software and cabling upgrades and enhancements. Design, install and administer new security systems and methods. Create and maintains security rights on network resources, maintain and administer the firewall rule base and authentication systems, monitor for network intrusions and security breaches & implement and enforce the enterprise network security policy and remote access standards and guidelines. Research and evaluate hardware and software for compatibility, serviceability, design, and performance, Additionally, develop specifications and recommend the purchase of computer/network- related hardware and software. Monitor trends and developments in systems, networking and multi-platform communication technologies & consult vendors and other sources on industry and product direction, functionality, and capabilities. Requirements Bachelors in computer engineering Minimum 10 years relevant experience TCP/IP Networking and complex configuration.  Training / Certifications: CCNA, CCNP. TCP/IP Networking, CISCO Router/Switch and networking devices.

About the job Lead of Interface NFS EPC-2 (N-1617)
Job Description Highlights: Bachelor Degree in Engineering discipline 
Minimum eight (8) years of experience in the oil and gas industry preferably in LNG industry with a minimum of 3 years in a management position.
Identify, develop, and lead closure of interfaces for the North Field South (NFS) CLLNG Balance of Plant (BOP) Contract applicable to NFXP EPC-2 project specifically related to Common Corridors owned by RLIC and Client (OPCO).
Ensure activities (including approvals) and interfaces with RLIC are undertaken in accordance with Project and NFXP EPC-2 Contractors needs in general, and compatible with Project schedule and cost objectives to avoid delays, change orders and claims.
Lead all internal and external Project Interfaces with NFS Onshore Project team, other EPCs (EPC1, EPC2, EPC3, EPC4), RLIC and third-party asset owners to secure alignment and expedite approvals of corridors, crossings, Plans and drawings as required to meet Project objectives.
Lead and coordinate all technical approvals and development of agreements for Land Lease, Corridor Lease, Utilities, Crossings, etc. with RLIC and Client LNG asset owners in a timely manner to ensure project activities are not delayed. 
Support and provide guidance to NFXP EPC-2 Contractors for interface matters related to RLIC and OPCO approvals. Assist in resolution of technical issues with RLIC and OPCO.
Lead and coordinate design, development, negotiation, interpretation, implementation, and delivery of executed commercial agreements with RLIC and Client LNG asset owners. Coordinate input and support from Client LNG Commercial and Legal for execution of commercial agreements and legal crossing agreements with RLIC and Client LNG asset owners.

About the job Head Project Controls EPC-2 (N-1965)
Job Description Highlights: The position is located at RLIC site and is responsible to deliver the most cost-effective method of performance for project administration, controls, cost and schedule through timely execution of key activities and compliance with standardized processes.
Bachelor degree in Engineering or Business related subject.
12 years experience in a major project environment within the oil and gas industry, with exposure in business management including project controls, cost and schedule development, tender preparation and contract management and 3 years supervising multi discipline and multi-cultural teams and as head of control for mega projects.

About the job Specialist EPM Solutions (Oracle)
The Senior Specialist EPM Solution (Oracle) is a consultant who drives EPM Cloud solution by interfacing with key customer stakeholders. The post holder drives the solution in collaboration with the vendors by creating solution architecture, high level design, migration approach and overall test strategy. S/he delivers high quality code deliverables for a module and leads a team during all types of testing and support activities related to implementation. Key Roles Provides functional & technical consulting services to clients Works closely with client management and users to define requirements and scope of development needs Configures, develops, and implements Oracle EPM Suite of products-based solutions based on identified clients requirements Provides mentoring and training services Provides application support for a variety of clients Performs the analysis necessary to design and architect solutions that meet client requirements Adheres to Client standards as they appear in the Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest policies Experience7+ years of relevant work experience inclusive of 4 years of experience in design, modeling, implementation, development and maintenance of EPM applications using Oracle Hyperion suite of products.2-3 years of end-to-end hands-on experience in implementing latest versions of Oracles Cloud Hyperion Education Bachelors Degree in a relevant Information Technology field

About the job Project Controls Specialist EPC-4 (N-2025) - 2
Job Description Highlights: The position is located at RLIC site and is responsible to support all aspects of project controls activities including reporting, schedule development, progress verification and change control.
Monitors the Contractors project controls performance in the areas of scheduling, progress measurement and reporting providing advice where necessary to make certain the Companys objectives are achieved.
Bachelor of Science in Engineering or relevant industry experience with thorough and extensive knowledge of a) Project controls principles, theories, concepts, and tools. b) Greenfield and brownfield.
Minimum of ten (10) years broad experience in the area of project controls, including cost, schedule, and progress reporting.
Minimum five (5) years experience associated with engineering, procurement, and construction for large (> $1BN) Onshore Facilities.
Minimum five (5) years experience associated with engineering, procurement, and construction of large onshore LNG plants.

description:

description: DESCRIPTION﻿Amazon is the most customer-centric company. In the light of this, the company is offering to our most engaged customers – sellers/vendors (and not only) the highest level of services, encouraging them to participate to grow their businesses on Amazon. As a Vendor Consultant (VC) you will help shape and deliver on a strategy for managing key metric pillars for Amazon Vendors. You will collaborate internally with leaders from Retail and Vendor Services teams and will be responsible for certain aspects of the vendor’s business with Amazon. Will engage directly with multiple internal teams to optimize business for key manufacturers (vendors) on Amazon websites. You will conceive, create and analyze a wide range of data, to grow the vendor’s traffic, brand awareness, customer conversion, and revenue on Amazon. Also, you will look into strategic and operational aspects of their business with Amazon, root cause analysis of issues and opportunities affecting the vendor’s business. Your focus will be on the strategic and operational aspects of managing the customer relationships with our vendors. Key job responsibilities• Support the performance of your internal teams on input metrics and impact of vendors on creating a great customer experience;• Partnering with Retail Team to manage vendor relationship by championing the vendor’s needs at Amazon;• Build strong communication channels at all levels, set proper expectations, provide clear status communications, and manage towards a growth plan for the vendors;• Build and execute on a strategic account plan that delivers on key business opportunities and relevant KPIs for the vendors and Amazon;• Work with internal Amazon teams/vendors to improve operational aspects of their business in providing a great consumer experience;• Conduct deep dive analysis on the handled issues for the vendors and develop recommendations and action plans based on data to improve vendor experience;• Provide thought leadership around planning, roadmaps and execution;• Establish long term partnerships with key vendor partners for the group of vendors handled;• Support the launches of new programs, categories and features;• Conduct regular weekly and monthly business reviews with the vendors, highlighting business metric performance and building action plans;• Metric influencing - understand metrics and create realistic forecasts. Take calculated risks, and react quickly with new action plans.

description: Job Description and Qualifications At Air Products, we've been helping our customers to become more productive, energy efficient and sustainable for more than 75 years. With approximately 15,000 employees and operations in 50 countries, we serve customers across a wide range of industries from food and beverage to medical, energy and transportation. We supply a unique portfolio of atmospheric and process gases, equipment and services. We require a skilled and experienced professional for the role of Operational Excellence Mechanical Integrity Engineering – Middle East that will provide technical and governance leadership in the area of Mechanical Integrity to the Middle East region operating organizations (wholly owned and JV’s) and provide a local interface between the regional Operating organizations, regional Business & Business Development teams, the regional Engineering teams and the Global Operational Excellence team. In this role, you will work as part of the Global Operational Excellence team and work with a local team of engineers. The position is in the Dhahran Techno Valley (DTV) office, in Dhahran, KSA and travel will be required in region (within KSA and outside) to engage with the operating facilities. As the Operational Excellence MI Engineer, Middle East, you will: Provide technical support to the Operating organization for development, execution, and assessment of complex inspection activities. This includes creating inspection scope packages and when necessary, traveling to the field to support execution. Conduct Fitness For Service evaluations for vessel, tank, and piping inspection results using API 579 analysis. Become a subject matter expert in the use of the Fitness For Service software. Provide technical support in option sorting repairs that may arise from the inspection activities. Evaluate cost of inspection versus equipment maintenance to develop end of life assessment strategies for various assets. Perform engineering design calculations and/or work with the AP Engineering Organization and 3rd party engineering contractors to implement design changes to pressure vessels and piping to address issues. Participate in pressure systems failure investigations. Implement recommendations as required. Develop a high level of expertise in existing and developing inspection technologies, including: Ultrasonic Phased Array and Shear Wave, ACFM, Eddy Current (heat exchanger and furnace tubes)
requirements:
Skills
Skills and Experience: Mechanical Engineering degree (BS) required. Advanced degrees a plus.5 years of industry experience with design and/or maintenance of vessels, tanks and piping. Knowledge of regional pressure vessel codes Knowledge of inspection/test procedures used to assess vessels, tanks, piping, and heat exchangers preferred but not required. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with operating teams, engineering and field contractors. Strong leadership skills to work across different operating teams and with outside parties.

description: Accountabilities!General: Systems Engineers are an important element in our overall CMMS support, and are a valuable resource in assuring that the system and Master Data are properly configured. They understand SAP and key business processes and are uniquely qualified to create and lead Maintenance databases. Master Data: Collaborates with others in the creation and maintenance of Master Data. This includes SAP and other active applications. They develop sophisticated tools and work processes to create and manipulate large quantities of data. These methods are used in support of SAP Releases, Capital Projects, MOCs, Procedures, and other refinements. Multiple businesses and regions are supported. The Lead Systems Engineer creates and tests special routines for mass manipulation to Functional Locations, Equipment and Preventative Maintenance tasks, and mentors others in their use. A library of routines is handled. They complete updates to local catalogs, codes and tables in SAP, which requires competence in the Client-level role PPJR25 and use of proprietary software. The role develops templates and guides which are used for standardized setup based on tag number, P&ID symbol, function, etc. Trains others in the setup and Classification of sophisticated systems and collaborates with the MD Team on the overall data process. The Lead Engineer also defines data standards for the local master data, and ensures that the configuration and data structure enables efficient usage and reporting. The role ensures that data setup supports the business requirements for all aspects of Corrective and Preventive Maintenance. SAP Releases: Has overall responsibility for collection, validation, and setup of data for SAP Releases. The position defines the methods to collect and structure Master Data, and guides others in the proper process and tools to use. The individual assures that up-to-date tools and work processes are used, and these are consistently applied globally. For Releases, there is frequent interaction and advice provided to the Core Team. Release support is planned and provided (on-site or remote) through the stabilization period. SAP Projects: The Lead Sr Systems Engineer identifies rework and refinement opportunities to improve productivity or CMMS functionality. These efforts often impact multiple sites or functional locations, and include the development of tools, methods and routines to complete non-standard adjustments. Detailed planning and testing is needed to assure success. Process Safety: Defines the setup of Process Safety objects, and audits SAP activities related to Relief Valves, Critical Safety Circuits, and other Mechanical Integrity covered equipment. In-depth knowledge is needed of the MI Procedures that define inspection and testing. The Engr collaborates with Safety authorities, MI Managers, Line and Maintenance Management to ensure that the CMMS setup and usage is aligned with Procedures and local laws. The MI setup is applied globally and becomes the basis for consistent execution and compliance reporting. The Lead Engr assumes responsibility for issuing reports on Process Safety Compliance. SAP PM Role: The Lead Engineer defines high-level configuration and the methods to implement new functionality. They work with the SAP IT team on configuration that supports PM and uses SAP and OSAP tools to set parameters and load Master Data in multiple SAP environments. Competence in the use of spreadsheets and Client Level transactions is needed to be successful. This is the Level 1 role, PPJR25. PM Data & Data Extracts: Standard Text is the basis for our PM Tasks and Plant Programs. The Lead Engineer has overall responsibility for handling the content of these tasks, including translations. Should be capable of extracting large quantities of data from CMMS, and performing a variety of checks and analysis. The extracts can be used to improve data quality and recommend updates to the MD Team. These extracts will typically involve sophisticated Excel skills to sort, compare and resolve data issues. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
requirements:
Skills
