This includes PM Power Users, Materials Management, Technical Experts, Plant personnel and the IT SAP group. Good Team, interpersonal and coordination skills are required, and the ability to communicate clearly.

description: The Senior Splunk Engineer role duties involve Post Sales activities on a high technical and outstanding quality level. Post Sales activities include professional services, design, audit, implementation, integration, and review of network and security solutions. The primary technologies part of this role will be SOC related technologies such as SIEM, EDR, VA. Researching innovative solutions for client needs Deliver a successful proof of concept for our clients Maintain a healthy project status Able to handle the customer demands and requests Provide the support for other team members Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in information security or IT-related matter or equivalent experience Deep understanding of technical concepts in a complex environment High experience with the ability to implement and deliver projects of the below products plus the highest certifications REQUIRED: Splunk SIEM, ESCarbon Black EDRTenable VASOARAny additional experience in other SIEM solutions such as Log Rhythm, QRadar…etc. will be an added point. Any additional experience in other technologies/vendors such as F5, Palo Alto, Infoblox, Thales and Beyond Trust will be considered as add-on. Understanding of information security concepts and related technology Strong background and experience in TCP/IP networking of large-scale organizations including routing and switching Understanding of Software Defined Networks (SDN) and virtualization Flexible work approach, based on the job requirements Being able to identify new work areas and to set new goals for themselves Good presentation skills Excellent and accent-free communication skills in English Proper and structured documentation and diagramming Excellent organizational skills in enterprise support Excellent communication and training skills Outstanding customer handling, friendly and goal-oriented Ability to communicate / translate to Customer-level Being able to understand complex business processes and activities Flexible work approach, based on the job requirements Being able to manage his/her own projects Arabic language is preferred Benefits Health insurance with one of the leading global providers for medical insurance Career progression and growth through challenging projects and work Employee engagement and wellness campaigns activities throughout the year Excellent learning and development opportunities Annual Flights Tickets Inclusive and diverse working environment Flexible/Hybrid working environment Open Door Policy About Us Help AG is the cybersecurity arm of e& enterprise (formerly Etisalat Digital) and provides leading enterprise businesses and governments across the Middle East with strategic consultancy combined with tailored information security services and solutions that address their diverse requirements, enabling them to evolve securely with a competitive edge. Present in the Middle East since 2004, Help AG was strategically acquired by e& (formerly Etisalat Group) in Feb 2020, hence creating a cybersecurity and digital transformation powerhouse in the region. Help AG has firmly established itself as the region's trusted IT security advisor by remaining vendor-agnostic, trustworthy, independent, and cybersecurity focused. With best-of-breed technologies from industry-leading vendor partners, expertly qualified service delivery teams and a state-of-the-art consulting practice, Help AG delivers unmatched value to its customers by strengthening their cyber defences and safeguarding their business.

We are seeking an experienced engineer specializing in Identity and Security solutions to join our dedicated technical support team. As an engineer, you will play a critical role in providing top-notch technical assistance and support for our clients' identity management and security needs. Your proficiency in Broadcom IGA (CA Identity Manager Suite), Broadcom Symantec Protection solutions (SEP, EDR, CAS), and potential knowledge in Microsoft PKI, n Cipher HSM, and Tripwire enterprise will be instrumental in ensuring the seamless operation of our client's systems. Responsibilities Serve as the First point of contact for technical support inquiries related to Broadcom IGA (CA Identity Manager Suite) and Broadcom Symantec Protection solutions (SEP, EDR, CAS). Conduct thorough analysis of reported issues, leveraging your expertise to diagnose and troubleshoot problems effectively. Provide step-by-step guidance to users, ensuring prompt and accurate resolution of technical issues. Collaborate closely with Level 2 (L2) and relevant teams to escalate complex cases and ensure proper documentation of case details. Document customer interactions, troubleshooting steps, and resolutions meticulously in the ticketing system. Stay current with the latest product knowledge and industry trends, enhancing your abilities to assist clients and expand your technical skills. Contribute to the creation and maintenance of knowledge base articles and documentation for common issues and solutions. Qualifications & Skills Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience in a technical support role, specializing in Broadcom IGA and Symantec Protection solutions. Proficient communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical users. Customer-focused mindset and a commitment to delivering outstanding support. Ability to collaborate effectively within a dynamic team environment. Knowledge of Microsoft PKI (Public Key Infrastructure) and its role in maintaining digital certificates and encryption. Familiarity with n Cipher HSM (Hardware Security Module) for secure key management and cryptography. Exposure to Tripwire Enterprise for security configuration management and compliance. Proficiency in Broadcom IGA (CA Identity Manager Suite), with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve identity management issues. Strong familiarity with Broadcom Symantec Protection solutions, including SEP (Symantec Endpoint Protection), EDR (Endpoint Detection and Response), and CAS (Content Analysis System). Sound understanding of computer systems, network architecture, and security protocols. Excellent problem-solving skills and the capacity to diagnose and rectify technical issues efficiently. Benefits Health insurance with one of the leading global providers for medical insurance. Career progression and growth through challenging projects and work. Employee engagement and wellness campaigns activities throughout the year. Excellent learning and development opportunities. Inclusive and diverse working environment. Flexible/Hybrid working environment. Annual flight tickets to home country. Open door policy. The Strategic Security Consultant is responsible for the successful engagement with the business development team, support in the development of opportunities, presales activities as well as successful delivery and completion of consultancy projects related to governance, risk and compliance services within the defined budget and timeline. This includes tasks related to third party cybersecurity risk management, data classification consulting, business impact analysis, risk assessments, and treatment planning, effectiveness measurements, development of policies and procedures, awareness presentations, and any other documentation to achieve compliance with the intended standards or compliance requirements within the KSA market. The Strategic Security Consultant will be expected to work independently and as part of a cross functional team, led by a project or program manager. Responsibilities Hands-on delivery of strategic consultancy projects related to but not limited to third party cybersecurity risk management, SOC consulting, data classification, ISO/IEC 270XX, ISO 22301, ISO/IEC 20000-1, NCA, SAMA, and CITC standards/regulations/requirements. Conduct presales and sales enablement activities in relation to the identified consulting services. Interface with management for project-related matters. Gaining familiarity with the technical products in the Help AG portfolio and guide staff in integrating this knowledge for the management system consultancy. Supporting the standardization activities. Identifying own areas of work and further developing existing work areas in strategic security consulting. Providing feedback on service lines enhancement. Representing Help AG Consulting team in event/PR. Qualification and Skills Native Arabic speaker will be preferred. Candidate inside KSA with a transferable iqama will be preferred. Minimum of 8 years of working experience in the KSA market in a similar capacity. Hands-on working experience in relation to third party cybersecurity risk management project execution. Excellent working knowledge of the following: SOC consulting, ISO/IEC 270XX, ISO 22301, ISO/IEC 20000-1, NCA, SAMA CSF, and CITC standards/ regulations/ requirements. Hands-on experience in delivery project activities related to the above. Excellent consulting skills; strong customer and business focus. University degree in a technical subject related to IT and/or Information Security. Track record in supporting presales and sales activities related to consulting services. Track record in implementing cybersecurity-related frameworks. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to understand complex business processes and activities. Flexible work approach, based on the job requirements. Industry professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, and CISA are desirable. Benefits Health insurance with one of the leading global providers for medical insurance. Career progression and growth through challenging projects and work. Employee engagement and wellness campaigns activities throughout the year. Excellent learning and development opportunities. Annual flight tickets to home country. Inclusive and diverse working environment. Flexible/Hybrid working environment. Open door policy. The Senior Cybersecurity Engineer will be responsible for the creation of procedures, implementation of process development, and maintenance of security systems across internal and client environments. The Senior Cybersecurity Engineer will work closely with Management, Security Operation Center Analysts, Threat Analysts, Solution Architects, other Security Engineers, and clients to complete high profile, critical services to existing Managed Security Service clients. This position will be based in Riyadh, KSA under the Managed Security Services (MSS) – Cyber Engineering department and will be responsible for the administration, maintenance, and integration of SOC technologies including SIEM, EDR, NDR, VA, SOAR, and other platforms. Responsibilities Administering Fidelis EDR & NDR technologies. Administering SIEM solutions (Splunk, QRadar, Log Rhythm…etc.). Integrating SIEM with a wide variety of legacy data sources. Handle the implementation/deployment/support of Vulnerability scan engines with Engineering, SOC, and IR. Document vulnerabilities and work on vulnerability mitigation with agreed SLA. Managing EDR sensors including deployment, operation, management, maintenance, update, upgrade, patching, and administration. Should be able to create watchlists to detect Indicators of Compromise (Io Cs) and malicious behavior of new threats. Assess customer needs and expectations, design solutions to meet those needs, and then implement the design. Quickly build and solve a problem using a new technology to determine viability. Serve as a primary responder for Managed Security customer systems, taking ownership of client configuration issues and tracking through resolution. Work closely with SOC team members to work on operational tasks/initiative to enhance the service quality. Proactively work on fine tuning false positives and enhancing the process along with other MSS teams. Develop content for SOC technologies (e.g., use cases for SIEM) in cooperation with SOC. Qualifications & Skills Experience and knowledge of Fidelis EDR & NDR is essential. Experience and knowledge of Splunk SIEM solution is preferred, other SIEM technologies are a plus. Minimum 3 years of professional experience supporting and maintaining SOC technologies. Professional experience working with networks and network architecture. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent training with experience working in a Security Operations Center, Managed Security, or client network environment. Information security knowledge in one or more areas such as EDR & NDR. Practical hands-on experience in EDR (e.g., Fidelis), NDR (Fidelis). Professional certificates are highly preferred (e.g., Fidelis, Splunk…etc.). Knowledge of Linux and Windows Operating Systems. Experience working with clients in a service delivery function. Adapt to learn new SOC technologies from different vendors. Provide after working hours support when needed. Experience working with internal and client ticketing and knowledge base systems for Incident and Problem tracking as well as procedures. Benefits Health insurance with one of the leading global providers for medical insurance. Career progression and growth through challenging projects and work. Employee engagement and wellness campaigns activities throughout the year. Excellent learning and development opportunities. Annual Flights Tickets. Inclusive and diverse working environment. Flexible/Hybrid working environment. Open Door Policy.

Job Title: Speaker Manager Opportunity Responsibilities: As the Speaker Manager, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless
coordination and support of speakers who have been confirmed for events. Your
primary focus will be on enhancing the speaker experience, facilitating their
engagement with our programs, and contributing to the success of our events.
You will be an essential part of the Programmes and Events Advisory pillar. Key Responsibilities: Speaker

building and maintaining strong relationships to ensure their needs and
expectations are met throughout the speaker journey. Travel
Coordination: Collaborate with the travel agency to coordinate all
travel arrangements for speakers, including flights, accommodations, and
transportation, ensuring a hassle-free travel experience. Information
Gathering: Gather comprehensive details from speakers for marketing and
communication purposes, including bios, headshots, presentation materials, and
any specific requirements they may have. Communication
Hub: Establish and maintain open and clear lines of communication with speakers,
addressing their queries, providing event details, and ensuring they are
well-informed about the event logistics. Event
Support: Provide dedicated support to speakers leading up to and during
the event, assisting with any last-minute needs, technical setups, and ensuring
their comfort and preparedness. Speaker
Engagement: Develop strategies to enhance speaker engagement and
participation in programs, fostering a sense of belonging and enthusiasm among
speakers. Logistical
Management: Manage the logistical aspects of speaker
participation, such as scheduling, session assignments, and ensuring speakers
are well-prepared and confident in their roles. Feedback
Collection: Gather feedback from speakers post-event to assess
their experience, identify areas for improvement, and implement enhancements to
the speaker program. Content
Coordination: Collaborate with content teams to ensure that speaker
materials are integrated seamlessly into the event program, including
presentations, panel discussions, and workshops. Emergencies
and Contingencies: Develop contingency plans and protocols to address
any unforeseen challenges that may arise during a speaker's participation in an
event. Budget
Monitoring: Assist in monitoring and tracking the budget related
to speaker logistics, travel, and accommodation, ensuring cost-effectiveness. Stakeholder
Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, partners, and
vendors to ensure the successful execution of speaker-related activities and
deliverables. Documentation: Maintain organized records of all speaker-related communications, agreements,
and documentation for future reference and reporting. Continuous
Improvement: Stay updated on industry best practices in speaker
management and suggest innovative approaches to enhance the speaker experience. Requirements Skills: The ideal candidate for the

organizational and communication skills. Strong
attention to detail and the ability to multitask effectively. Problem-solving
abilities to address speaker-related challenges. Customer
service-oriented mindset with a focus on speaker satisfaction. Proficiency
in event management software and tools. Adaptability
to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Collaborative
team player with the ability to work cross-functionally. Previous
experience in speaker management or event coordination is a plus. Benefits Visa and Medical Insurance (if required) for the duration of this contract only

About the job System Admin
Job Description Installing and configuring and upgrading computer hardware and software. Respond to support queries from help desk ticketing system, phone and email. Installing and upgrading anti-virus software to ensure security at the user level. Performing tests and evaluations on new software and hardware. Installing and troubleshooting of CCTV. Responsible for PCs, Printers, and related equipment (monitor, keyboard, mouse, hard drive, etc.). Managing employees' emails/accounts. Adding and updating inventory of all equipment, software, and license users. Creating and updating IT data documentation if needed. ﻿﻿﻿Requirements﻿﻿ Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.5+ years of experience working in a help desk environment. Job Description:
Our client is a leading Facility Management Company in Qatar that specializes in providing customized facility solutions and services to a diverse range of industries. They are looking to hire a Hard Services Manager to lead, Develop and implement operational strategies which lead to Company growth. Duties and responsibilities: Provide excellent service and meet or exceed client expectations and contract objectives. Identify opportunities to improve and expand the scope of services. Make recommendations to clients and management as appropriate. Monitor market trends and best practices. Provide insights and recommendations to improve quality and efficiency. Manage department budgets in accordance with company policies and guidelines. Continuously improve quality of service through innovations and implementation of best practices. Create reports and presentations for various audiences including staff, committees, and executives. Continuously improve facilities management services to deliver consistent high-quality outcomes. description:
Taldeen is a newly formed company based in Hail, Saudi Arabia. Taldeen provides specialized B2B plastic industrial solutions across various fields of industry. The company’s production arm occupies a giant complex of over 100,000m2 that produces various specialized plastic solutions and handling products. Formed by Tasnee, the company borrows heavily from its founder and is strongly committed to the latest technologies and product innovation. In addition, Tasnee provides a wealth of knowledge to Taldeen through its experience in a wide range of industries and an impeccable success record. An exciting opportunity is available for Technician II, Mechanical Based in Hail. and will report directly to Maintenance Sr Supervisor. About the role: Performs standard work routines on a board range of equipment. Requires authoritative knowledge of Mechanical specialized methods acquired on the job or through certification. Determines solutions using different elements of their experience. You will be responsible to: Analyze performance of equipment and participates in fault analysis and troubleshooting.
Guide technically less experienced technicians to carry out basic activities and usage of testing equipment.
Read Mechanical Maintenance manuals, specifications, procedures and follows clear instructions for setting up test practices.
Comply with all relevant HSE standards; seeks to ensure a healthy, safe work environment and working practices all times.
Use sophisticated testing equipment and tools to test and troubleshoot routine to complex Mechanical equipment.
Test and repairs Mechanical equipment and using relevant knowledge and experience.
Perform advanced preventive and corrective maintenance of Mechanical equipment that requires good technical experience.
Install new cables, wiring and Instrumentation fixtures. Inspects I/E equipment at frequent interval and rectifies any faults.
Calibrate, maintains, repairs mechanical equipment as directed.
About You: Minimum Qualification: Degree or Diploma combined with relevant experience.
Minimum Experience: Minimum 7 Years of hands-on experience in plastic industries (Injection molding machines, pipe extrusion machines, blown film machines). 
Required Skills: Good knowledge in the trouble shooting of mechanical/hydraulic/ pneumatic system/mold repairing.
Able to communicate fluently in English, with an ability to read the drawings & understand the technical manuals, instruction of machine manufacturer.
Achieving Results.
Embracing Change.
Developing Capability.
Working Collaboratively.

description: Location Saudi Arabia, Riyadh﻿﻿﻿﻿???? Location: The majority of work will take place on-site at football stadiums in Riyadh, with further opportunities for travel across Saudi Arabia and internationally???? Contract: Permanent, Full-Time???? Salary: Competitive???? Start Date: Immediate????*About the Role As a Football Systems Operator, you'll be responsible for setting up, monitoring, and operating our systems on-site at football stadiums in your region. You'll play a key role in the delivery of our services to SAFF, the AFC Champions League and major international tournaments like the World Cup. You will start out working on our Goal Line Technology and Semi Automated Offside services, but there will be the chance to gain exposure to various other services (such as VAR) as you grow in the role and become a more experienced member of the team. We will equip you with the technical training, assistance and full exposure to our systems to excel in this role.????Key Responsibilities Pre-match planning Setting up Hawk-Eye technology in the stadium (this can involve physically demanding work, such as rigging cameras and running cables) Conducting pre-match set up, checks and calibration of the systems in accordance with standard procedures Liaising with stadium staff, match officials and host broadcasters Monitoring the systems during the match Monitoring hardware and software performances, troubleshoot and report encountered issues Taking full ownership of our system on-site and being an ambassador for Hawk-Eye During the off-season, building and maintaining our hardware and equipment Assisting with installation and testing of new products and services ????Your Skills, Knowledge and Expertise A technical background; with a desire to work with and learn new technologies Excellent problem-solving skills coupled with an inquisitive mindset Proactive attitude and good time management skills Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced environment  Ability to liaise with clients and customers in a professional and approachable manner Willingness to travel domestically and to work overseas Flexible and adaptable to a schedule that is dedicated by the fixture list and can change at short notice. We work whenever football happens, which means lots of weekends and evening matches A full valid driving licence is required and willingness to drive our vans Nice to have:  Experience working with video technology/replay technology desirable, or live event/technical production At Hawk-Eye Innovations, we appreciate and value the importance of potential and growth. If you do not hit all of the criteria above but believe that there are certain areas you excel in and that you possess the passion and desire to develop the other attributes, then we encourage you to apply.⚽Make an Impact in the World of Football Join our dedicated and dynamic team and help revolutionise the way technology is used in Football! As a Football Systems Operator, you'll gain invaluable experience and play a crucial role in some of the biggest Football events in the world.

Description At Pw C, we measure success by our ability to create the value that our clients and our people are looking for. Our reputation lies in building lasting relationships with our clients and a focus on delivering value in all we do. We’re a network of firms in 158 countries with more than 236,000 people who are committed to delivering world-class capabilities and quality in assurance, tax and advisory services. Established in the region for 40 years, Pw C Middle East employs over 4,200 people across 12 countries. Complementing our depth of industry expertise and breadth of skills is our sound knowledge of local business environments across the Middle East region. Our tailored solutions help our clients meet the challenges and opportunities of doing business in the Middle East market and beyond. Job Description & Summary We are Pw C Middle East.  Our business makes change happen. With around 8,000 people across 12 countries in the Middle East, you’ll play a part in building a human-led, tech-powered future. We operate regionally, connecting more than 295,000 people across the globe, bringing together unique knowledge and experiences. About our Co-op Program Our Co-op Internships offer high caliber students the opportunity to experience work and life at Pw C, and gain a valuable insight into our business and culture. You’ll work alongside graduate trainees and experienced professionals on live and interesting client projects. You will be doing real work on real clients so be prepared to get involved. The Coop is due to start in January 2024. The opportunity It’s an exciting time to join us in Assurance. The latest digital tools and technology help us deliver the highest-quality audits for some of the leading companies in Pw C’s global client network. But Assurance is about far more than audit. We provide clients with a range of Other Assurance Services, from assessing the sustainability of a supply chain to compliance with companies’ internal governance policies. In all our work, we help clients achieve their true potential, whether we are guiding them through challenging accounting regulations, delivering trust and transparency solutions or reassuring shareholders with an accurate financial statement. To know more about our Assurance business and what we offer: Click here Discover what a career with us is all about, and boost your employability. You’ll find out first-hand if this is the career for you - perform well, and you could be offered a graduate job. Working alongside specialists, you’ll work on client projects to give you the best insight into what we’re about. You’ll have the opportunity to build networks with your colleagues and peer group. Job Description As a co-op you'll gain invaluable industry experience, work with inspiring people driven to make a difference and become a part of a culture that thrives on the diversity of its people. You'll work on client engagements, take part in projects addressing some of the tough challenges and strengthen your skills while witnessing the impact of your contribution. And you'll have a potential fast track into our Graduate Program at the end of the co-op. The teams you could join include: Core Assurance: Audit Capital Markets & Accounting Advisory Business Controls Risk Digital Trust Financial Services What we are looking for Be eligible for a Co-op internship and available for the full 28 weeks, with your university and final year student with a related degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or similar and a cumulative GPA of 3.0/4Arabic-speaking candidates are preferred. Have the legal right to work in the country you are applying without restrictions, we do not provide sponsorship for our internships Additional information Develop your skills through one-on-one coaching and mentoring Undertake challenging client work and engagements with potentially broad social impacts Attend networking events Expand your professional and personal networks with like-minded peers Expand your career potential with a globally respected organization We want all of our people to feel empowered to be the best that they can be, find out more about our firmwide Employee Value Proposition: Click Here If this sounds like the opportunity for you, Apply Now!Travel Requirements0%Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?No Government Clearance Required?No For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

Description Who is Tenable?Tenable® is the Exposure Management company. 40,000 organizations around the globe rely on Tenable to understand and reduce cyber risk. Our global employees support 60 percent of the Fortune 500, 40 percent of the Global 2000, and large government agencies. Come be part of our journey! What makes Tenable such a great place to work? Ask a member of our team and they’ll answer, “Our people!” We work together to build and innovate best-in-class cybersecurity solutions for our customers; all while creating a culture of belonging, respect, and excellence where we can be our best selves. When you’re part of our #One Tenable team, you can expect to partner with some of the most talented and passionate people in the industry, and have the support and resources you need to do work that truly matters. We deliver results that exceed expectations and we win together!Your Role: Tenable is seeking a Security Engineer-Industrial Security Specialist. This is a Pre-Sales Systems Engineer role. The person in this role will partner with our specialist OT account team as well as front line generalist teams to provide pre-sales technical systems engineering support for our customers. This role requires the deep expertise in Operational Technology environments as well as the ability to understand the relevant business and security decision drivers. The person in this role will partner with our specialist OT account team as well as front line generalist teams to provide pre-sales technical systems engineering support for our customers. The OT Security Engineer is a critical component of the Tenable sales team with key responsibilities including discover of requirements, demonstrations, running Proof of Values engagements and advising on proper architecture and use of our solutions. Your Opportunity:·       Engagement in key potential OT accounts where SMEs are required to create, advance and close OT opportunities·       Participate in discovery sessions with new and existing customers to understand customer need and determine solution fit·       Run product demonstrations of the Tenable Solution·       Deliver Proof of Value engagements remotely and occasionally on site·       Enable and empower field to sell OT through formal trainings and informal meetings·       Represent Field needs to the Product Organization, and influence the roadmap for product development in the areas of:·       How customers use Security products·       How Tenable products fit into enterprise ecosystems·       Theatre-specific needs (localization, compliance, etc.)·       Up to 25% travel What You'll Need:·       Past hands-on experience in OT environments, specifically in Energy or Manufacturing·       Deep technical expertise around OT environments (both from a security and operational perspective)·       Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory requirements around cyber risk management specific to ICS·       Ability to tie OT security back to broader strategic risk and our Exposure story·       Ability to travel up to 25%If you’ve reached this point, and you’re still not sure if you should apply….. Just do it! We’re human and we don’t fit a perfect mold. Having diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives, that’s a good thing! If you’re coming from outside of the cyber industry - great! If you’re looking to try something new - awesome! All we ask is you bring passion to all that you do, crave creativity and innovation, and embrace the hard work of gaining new skills and accepting big challenges. We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

Senior Engineer – Biomedical "Job Details" Job Description JOB SUMMARYThe Senior Engineer - Biomedical is responsible for the supervision of assigned BME Technicians and Technologists and functions in a senior technical capacity on a variety of assigned medical equipment (working supervisory position). Supervises, coordinates and influences all functions related to the daily safety testing, repair and maintenance of biomedical patient care equipment. Provides on-site leadership for all components of the medical equipment management plan, and participates in the development of departmental policies, programs and continuous quality improvement initiatives. Maximizes patient safety by supporting proper use, application and operational performance for patient care equipment. Acts as a technical resource to other BME staff for repair and maintenance activities on selected equipment and systems. KEY ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES Contributes to the day-to-day management of the Biomedical Engineering operations according to departmental policies and processes. Provides critical problem solving and decision-making including work prioritization of equipment with higher clinical repair needs. Provides autonomous management of time in coordination with the BME Director and in consideration of departmental-wide strategies, policies and systems for workforce planning, occupational health and safety, education and training and performance management. Demonstrates an on-going commitment to service quality improvement and ensures a high-level commitment to professional job performance and customer service throughout Sidra. Promotes and maintains effective communication with all team members of the BME department towards achieving the departmental objectives. Participates in the use of a paperless, CAFM integrated, equipment maintenance program incorporating the transfer of test data from BME specific automated test equipment to generate accurate data and relevant histories in compliance with JCIA standards. Supports implementation and ongoing improvement of BME department service-related programs, including operational standards and relevant key performance indicators. Ensures the availability of relevant electronic data to the BME Director for analysis of maintenance operations and performance as required in support of selected KPI’s. Develops balanced work schedules within the CAFM program for self and subordinate staff, while considering flexible leave schedules. Evaluates assigned staff productivity, efficiency and other specific work quality performance indices. Participates in staff evaluations for assigned staff. Ensures subordinate staff has adequate resources to perform assigned repairs and maintenance. Coordinates with BME Trainer to ensure that all technical staff have been trained or demonstrated competence on assigned equipment. Monitors monthly expenses and works with management in recommendations for controlling operational costs. Coordinates test equipment repairs and scheduled testing for JCI compliance. Functions as a resource person for assigned equipment, which may include providing scheduled or on-the-spot instruction to clinical staff regarding the safe and proper use of medical equipment. Collaborates with other support departments (FM, or IT), to develop support plans for those devices requiring multi-disciplinary support. Adheres to Sidra’s standards as they appear in the Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest policies. QUALIFICAITIONS & EXPERIENCEEducation Bachelor’s degree in electronic/ biomedical engineering Experience A minimum of 5+ years progressively more advanced technical experience in the Biomedical Engineering field ranging from hands-on to senior technical roles, followed by a minimum of 3+years supervisory level experience (i.e., a minimum 8+ years total BME experience). Demonstrated experience participating in JCAHO or JCIA accreditation surveys. Full understanding of the IEC 80001-1 standard Combinations of education and experience will be considered.* Multicultural workplace experience

Overview: Soft Programs Technology is a customer-centric Incorporation, with a main focus on providing exceptional quality IT solutions & Services to enterprises. We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Oracle EBS Financial Consultant to join our team. The Oracle Financial Consultant will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing Oracle Financial solutions tailored to meet client requirements. This position requires strong technical expertise, financial acumen, and the ability to work closely with clients to achieve their consolidation goals. Responsibilities: Planning: The consultant plan and recommend solutions that enhance current financial systems to align with corporate goals. description: QA/QC Engineer plays a crucial role in ensuring that construction projects adhere to established quality standards and meet regulatory requirements. Develop and implement quality control plans and procedures for construction projects. description: At Gettechforce we help companies build their teams.   We currently have over 30 remote developers in Egypt and are looking to expand our team now, by looking for an exceptional Senior Data Engineer to help us define and build our next generation data platform on top of Google Cloud, guiding its direction and integration within the company. We are currently expanding our team in Egypt, so you will have access to our other developers and we plan on having nights out and events with other team members as we continue to grow. This role may be for you if... You are curious to understand business needs and how to transform those requirements into data. You view the present world as a pool of data and believe it is your job to create the tools and platforms needed to process it all. You believe in a future where every business is data driven, making insightful decisions based on the data available, rather than being lost and dragged down by it. When you hear the words ETL you are curious about the past we are living in since you process everything in real-time, using the latest technology. You wonder if you will ever use the challenging algorithms you've learned in your Computer Science background on a day to day basis, or if it was just all for theory. About Etihad Airways Etihad Airways, the national airline of the UAE, was formed in 2003 and quickly went on to become one of the world’s leading airlines. From its home in Abu Dhabi, Etihad flies to passenger and cargo destinations in the Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, Australia and North America. Together with Etihad’s codeshare partners, Etihad’s network offers access to hundreds of international destinations. In recent years, Etihad has received numerous awards for its superior service and products, cargo offering, loyalty programme and more. Etihad is recognised as one of the world’s leading airlines in response to COVID-19 and was the first airline in the world to fully vaccinate its crew on board. Etihad sees tackling the climate crisis as the most important issue of our time, and through strategic partnerships with major global aviation brands and OEMs, Etihad is relentless in its pursuit of industry decarbonisation. To learn more, visit etihad.com

We recruit, reward, and develop our people based on merit regardless of race, nationality, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, marital status or disability. We value our people and treat everyone who works for or with Petrofac fairly and without discrimination. The world is re-thinking its energy supply and energy security needs; planning for a phased transition to alternative energy sources. We are here to help our clients meet these evolving energy needs. This is an exciting time to join us on this journey.   We support flexible working requests and have adopted a hybrid approach for most of our office-based roles. We ask employees to be present in the office at least three days per week. Are you ready to bring the right energy to Petrofac and help us deliver a better future for everyone? JOB TITLE: Principal Engineer - Cathodic Protection KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Accountable for overall discipline related activities for the successful completion of project within allotted schedule, manpower and costs.
Prepare and issue Cathodic Protection Design basis, Specification and other technical documents
Review of Vendor offers and design package
Coordinate on technical issues with other Engineering Disciplines as required. Provide the necessary inputs/data to other disciplines as per the requirements and procedures.

Participate in 3D Model and Constructability reviews along with Client and representatives of other engineering disciplines
Meet with vendor representatives, inspect at vendor works and workshops and provide assistance to Quality Department as required.

Interface and provide clarifications, guidance and technical support to Construction and Commissioning teams as required.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical/Metallurgy/Electrochemical Engineering 
Minimum of 15 years related oil & gas/petrochemical experience preferable, with a background of working for EPC/consultancy organizations/CP specialist Vendors

Additional Information

Synopsis As Etihad continues to grow its network and fleet, we have an incredibly exciting opportunity to join our Revenue Division in a pivotal role; Network Revenue Optimization Manager. In this role you will lead a cross-functional team to develop and implement Etihad’s revenue optimization strategy. You will collaborate with Revenue Management leadership to develop and implement revenue maximizing with JV & Alliance partners. You will review and provide inputs to global business cases created by network planning for structural and seasonal changes to the Etihad network. Accountabilities Corroborate with RM teams to build route strategies in co-ordination with S/MMs to introduce/implement new routes/frequencies to the Network, measure performance & update senior leadership.
Lead review of business cases created by network planning for structural and seasonal cases with Regional RM teams
Negotiate and challenge any Network Planning assumptions and provide alternative assumptions
Continuously monitor Network performance for incremental revenue opportunities
Identify gaps between and EY & partner carriers and co-ordinate with RM/NP teams to minimize these and capitalize on opportunities
Support strategic evaluations related to fleet configurations and hub structures
Create plans that identify and prioritize partners within Alliances portfolio that maximize enabled revenue
 Build strategies for management and monitoring of network revenue performance of Codeshare and Alliance partners
Deliver and present performance reviews of revenue contribution from tactical or structural activity   
Proactively build revenue assumptions for RM driven network opportunities and consult with Network Planning for options.
Calendarize network peak periods and conduct scheduled reviews with SMMs / Heads for periods of absolute peak demand & events. Recommend actions to further enhance network revenue performance.
Be the focal point of contact with Network Planning teams for any revenue estimations.
Education & Experience Minimum Bachelors’ degree, preferably Business or Engineering (post-grad. qualifications an advantage)
Minimum of 5 years’ experience within either Network Planning, Revenue Management or Alliances with deep understanding of Pricing and Inventory
About Etihad Airways Etihad Airways, the national airline of the UAE, was formed in 2003 and quickly went on to become one of the world’s leading airlines. From its home in Abu Dhabi, Etihad flies to passenger and cargo destinations in the Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, Australia and North America. Together with Etihad’s codeshare partners, Etihad’s network offers access to hundreds of international destinations. In recent years, Etihad has received numerous awards for its superior service and products, cargo offering, loyalty programme and more. Etihad is recognised as one of the world’s leading airlines in response to COVID-19 and was the first airline in the world to fully vaccinate its crew on board. Etihad sees tackling the climate crisis as the most important issue of our time, and through strategic partnerships with major global aviation brands and OEMs, Etihad is relentless in its pursuit of industry decarbonisation. To learn more, visit etihad.com

Introduction As a Test Specialist at IBM, your analytical and technical skills will directly impact the quality of the software we create. Come work in an agile environment where you will help each iteration reach the next level. Whether the testing is manual, automated, or cognitive, you hold a key role in releasing the best deliverables to IBM’ers and our clients. Your Role and Responsibilities Builds automation for the testing IT systems and applications. Has deep skills in multiple test automation tools and technologies and use these to build and maintain automation solutions to test applications and IT systems across the levels of testing. Responsible to understand testing requirements, building optimized test scenarios, developing automation to execute test along with test data and environment related automation, execute automated testing and achieve test outcome. Has understanding to all the contemporary technology trends – Agile, Dev Ops, Containers and so have ability to integrate testing automation into overall delivery automation. Required Technical and Professional Expertise 1 to 4 years of experience as a test specialist, must have experience in performance testing. solid understanding and experience on programming languages ex: java  solid experience on creation and executing for automation test scripts  Excellent problem solving, analytical and communication skills (both oral and written) Experience with test-driven development Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise NA

Perform development tasks (backend & frontend) within an agile environment. Handle existing software problems and carry out requested changes in a timely manner. Participate in team meetings and brainstorming sessions to contribute ideas for our products. Learn new technologies and work with diverse technologies and languages. Write technical documentation for software components and features.

description:
General information  Organisation As an international subsidiary of the SPIE group specializing in the energy sector, SPIE Oil & Gas Services has been working at the heart of energy production infrastructures for several decades, designing, installing, starting up and maintaining them, while ensuring the best possible conditions in terms of safety, costs, lead times and quality. With over 4,300 employees of 64 different nationalities working in 22 countries in Europe, Africa, Asia-Pacific and the Middle East, SPIE Oil & Gas Services offers its customers from the oil, gas and renewable energy industries sustainable solutions in the following areas: well delivery & management, projects, engineering & construction, assessment & competency development, commissioning & start-up, operations, maintenance & asset integrity. With around 48,000 employees and a strong local presence, SPIE achieved in 2022 consolidated revenues of €8.09 billion and consolidated EBITA of €511 million.

job_title: Technical Sales Leader - Data&AI, Automation - UAE
description: Introduction A Technical Sales Leader within IBM is a proven technology practitioner. Through leadership of deeply technical sales teams, you’ll influence clients’ technology strategies by leveraging IBM products, services, and people to solve their most complex business challenges. Managing all technical sales roles at a market of country level, you’ll be responsible for the training, coaching, and mentoring of technical talent across your teams. Integrating market /country cross-brand technical leaders, you’ll encourage synergies that drive development and growth. For your clients. For IBM. And for our people. As a technical visionary you’ll paint convincing pictures of the future that apply IBM technologies, infused with modern IT architectures, which are integrated with offerings that clearly show customers how their hardest problems will be solved. Excellent onboarding will set you up for positive impact, whilst ongoing development will continue to advance your career. Our sales environment is fast-paced and supportive. Always connected to a wider team, you’ll be surrounded by other managers and colleagues. People who are always willing to help and be helped as you scale your business, with and through your team, as they compel clients to continually invest in IBM. Your Role and Responsibilities Deep, practitioner-expertise and business domain knowledge in your specialist areas will present you as credible, confident, and convincing. With a perfect blend of deep technical experience and people engagement skills, you’ll help your teams articulate the technology decision points (TDPs) and IBM sales plays in the context of your clients’ digital transformation ambitions. Advocating for leading-edge technologies and digital transformation you’ll pave the way for your teams’ continued successes and development by bringing the full technology power of IBM to your customers. People who will be receptive because of your natural ability to create trusted and enduring relationships that establish IBM as an essential partner in solving their most difficult technical problems. Your primary responsibilities will include: Client Relationship Management: Connecting a broad network of technical experts, serving as the single point of accountability for IBM product and service quality, and playing a central role in resolving client critical situations.  Technology Expertise: Leveraging broad and deep technology expertise to provide highly contextual insights into the benefits of emerging technology adoption.  Thought Leadership and Transformation: Providing technical thought-leadership and direction to teams for the client’s transformation agenda. Bringing an outside-in perspective while recommending disruptive technologies and approaches to scale new value capture. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Client Market/Industry Expertise: Veteran-level technical practitioner experience in one or more client market/industry segments, with a track record of winning through collaboration, resilience, empathy, and innovation. A natural at inspiring and motivating others to succeed in highly complex, enterprise-scale, technically complex sales environments.  Technical Expertise: Technical knowledge around cloud, data & AI, automation, security, and storage technologies, in addition to deep industry knowledge and contemporary methods for co-creating client solutions, with and through others.  Communication and Influencing: Palpable people, communication, and collaboration skills, with a proven record networking and influencing throughout the successful closure of complex technology sales cycles (including $multi-million deals). Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise IBM Product Experience: Experience of working with any of IBM’s products and services (training across IBM’s product suite will be provided).

job_title: Senior Managing Consultant, Advisors Business Development, Digital
description: Our Purpose We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results. Title and Summary Senior Managing Consultant, Advisors Business Development, Digital Overview Master Card Advisors, the professional services arm of Master Card Worldwide, provides payments-focused consulting, marketing, information and risk management services to financial institutions and merchants worldwide. With its unique category expertise, deep understanding of customer needs and successful track record in addressing complex challenges throughout the payments lifecycle, Master Card Advisors addresses the challenges and opportunities of its clients, enhances Master Card's strategic and tactical performance and establishes Master Card's global thought-leadership pre-eminence. Role Description and Major Responsibilities• Lead sales calls and new client development across Digital topics for all accounts as part of the EEMEA Digital Business Development team• Deliver against sales targets for existing accounts and/or contribute to Master Card Worldwide deal bids• Capture senior and mid-level clients’ implicit business needs in addition to articulated requests, and identify most critical aspects of the problem• Translate objectives into key hypotheses and structure work for large/complex projects or ill-defined problems• Contribute to formal and informal pitches, from “storyboarding” through face-to-face presentation• Create succinct, persuasive written materials tailored to the “level” of the audience• Contribute to project delivery, quickly identifying shortcomings in projects and take remedial action• Manage complete capture of assignment knowledge and drive to ensure it is available firm-wide (knowledge management)• Contribute as a thought leader to the development of intellectual capital, point of views, articles, and blogs• Leverage deep knowledge of all the Master Card Advisors capabilities and how they fit together to offer new innovative solutions All About You Education Needed• Undergraduate degree required• MBA or relevant post graduate degree recommended Experience and Skills Needed• Experience in top management consulting firms and in relevant industry • Knowledge of payments market, trends and opportunities• Demonstrates the ability to initiate, develop, and close a sale• Excellent verbal and written communication skills• Excellent analytical skills, including ability to frame the customer’s opportunity in financial terms (i.e. value quantification) • Ability to think from the perspective of the customer• Ability to gain consensus with others and coordinate team of consultants and subject matter experts around goal• Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment• Advanced Word, Excel and Power Point skills• Proficiency in written and verbal English Corporate Security Responsibility All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must: Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

job_title: Senior Analyst - Business Application - Oracle Fusion
description: Senior Analyst - Business Application - Oracle Fusion "Job Details" Job Description JOB SUMMARYThe Senior Analyst – Applications - Oracle Fusion is responsible for the leading and executing the Analysis, Design and Build related to the ERP. The Senior Analyst – Applications - Oracle Fusion will be responsible for the execution and schedule to meet the business needs of the organization. The Senior Analyst –Applications - Oracle Fusion has a solid background in ERP solutions. The incumbent analyses complex solutions, creates designs, develops and reviews build, executes and manages testing of the build and prepares build documentation and evidence to meet the business needs of the organization. S/he manages and maintains the schedule against the constantly changing priorities of the organization and ensures that the activities are completed on schedule. KEY ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES Provides technical support and incident resolutions for ERP applications Raises tickets with vendors to provide fixes and patches to key incidents Leads the technical development of the ERP applications Designs, develops and quality tests for all ERP applications and interfaces Develops and supports Paa S solutions Customizes application software to support the business requirements as required Analyses and investigates business requirements related to ERP system Assists in ERP application implementations and assists in testing end user processes using defined guidelines Collects data and creates reports in response to business requests Supports in the analysis of business needs and documents technical requirements to support system enhancements Creates communication plans (correspondence, presentations, and other materials) for knowledge transfer to leadership. Performs other technical tasks related to ERP space Logs and tracks basic problems/work tickets with external product vendors or support organizations. Responds quickly and efficiently to any application related incident that is sent via help desk to the team Apply a basic understanding of the underlying principles of a professional discipline -typically obtained through formal study. Works with other Sidra IT teams around the integrated systems and business processes to enable fully integrated business flows. Analyzes user requirements and challenges to create technical solutions that add value to the business as a whole. Ability to relate actual day-to-day work to business priorities. QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCEEducation Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field Experience5+ years of experience in Oracle ERP applications  3+ years of Oracle Fusion implementation experience in in organizations of similar size and function. Hands-on functional and technical experience supporting Oracle Fusion ERP in large, complex enterprise environments. * With extensive knowledge of business processes as relates to Oracle Fusion ERP. Strong understanding of Oracle Fusion ERP data structures, configurations, and processes.

Job details Location: Dubai  Salary: AED 36,000 – 42,000 Per Month  Job Type: Permanent  Discipline: IT & Technology Reference: 936040  Posted: about 10 hours ago  Share this job  Job description Charterhouse is working with a leading global education provider who is looking to hire a Metadata Management Lead to join their tech division in Dubai. About the role The Metadata Management Lead will play a crucial part within the data engineering team. This role will be responsible for establishing robust metadata management frameworks, implementing the metadata catalog, data integration, and much more. This position will start as an individual contributor role with the aim to lead/manage a team within 18-24 months. The client is looking for someone who can see the big picture and would be happy to have a 100% hands-on role initially. About you To be considered for this role, the successful candidate will hold a Master's or Bachelor’s Degree in IT or another related field. Knowledge of data design, engineering, data governance, and data warehousing is essential. Our client is looking for someone who has over 6 years of experience in the Data sector, coming from a technology background. Management experience would be beneficial and this role will eventually be required to grow and lead a team. Attitude is important for this position as you will be required to speak with top management and stakeholders on a regular basis. The candidate should also possess excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.

Transguard Group was established in 2001 and has diversified significantly, we lead in the fields of Cash Services, Security Services, Manpower Services, Facilities Management & Aviation. Transguard Group is the UAE’s most trusted business support and outsourcing provider and has a large, dynamic and culturally diverse workforce with 50,000 employees!
We are currently recruiting for an Account Manager to join our Facilities Management Soft Services team at Transguard Group.
Scope 
Manage allocated customer accounts in line with the commercial agreement, ensuring we maintain 100% of clients, grow the accounts as well as manage the relationship in line with the commercial agreement. 
Responsibilities
Commercial Management
Responsible for developing the business growth of the account
Implicitly understand the commercial aspects of the contract and manage the service delivery within the boundaries of the contract
Prepare a quarterly report with monthly operational data to support the review of the financial performance of the contracts in question
Investigate with the Divisional Manager the reason why any expected gross profit on the contract is not met. Explore %u201Cmanagement solutions%u201D to address the issue.
Ensure invoices are prepared, delivered and paid
Monitor billable vs non billable staff 
Report any variations to the contract to the Divisional Manager and ensure that these are reviewed and agreed with the client
Client Management
Develop a good working relationship with the client and hold regular client meetings to ensure the smooth running of the contract 
Undertake site visits to view staff performance and discuss and resolve any issues raised by the client regarding the quality of the service 
Monitor that the service delivered is within the contract terms. If not discuss variations with the client and Business Unit Head 
Explore further business opportunities with the client 
Plan ahead and agree with the client for any new staff requirements to meet any future peaks and troughs 
Ensure the work schedules developed for the staff match the client requirements 
Staff Management

Manage operational Team Members 
Hold staff meetings, monthly or as required
Conduct site visits to view staff performance and help to motivate staff
Plan mobilization of staff according to agreed timescales with the client 
Arrange site specific induction and training of new staff
Check and sign off the monthly payroll

Monitor absence and accident rates and undertake any correction actions required
Approve staff leave
Monitor staff performance and nominate staff for the Employee of the Month award
Monitor that work schedules are being followed by the operations team

Wood is currently looking for a Senior Electrical Engineer to join our team in Dubai, UAEAccountability: This is a Home Office position based in Dubai,normal working time will be 48 hours per week
Reporting to the Lead Electrical Engineer, the candidate will assume sole responsibility for assigned Electrical engineering work scopes.
To carry out Electrical discipline work within a project team, supporting the project team for field development of oil & gas production facilities.
To plan, budget, organize, and control a segment of the Electrical engineering deliverables for the project.
Primary Role: To prepare Electrical deliverables for a project n the oil and gas industry, and ensure that they conform to all applicable engineering codes and standards as well as the Client’s policies and procedures.
To ensure that all work is completed without compromise to quality and is delivered according to the project schedule.
To provide direction and guidance on all Electrical engineering technical queries raised by either internal or external parties.
To liaise with the Client’s Engineering, Operations and Maintenance staff as required to ensure a consistent approach to project completion.
To promote safe behaviour at all times.
Principal Responsibilities: To provide sound technical advice and solutions to a diversity of technical problems within the discipline.
To co-ordinate with other disciplines during all stages of design development, construction, pre-commissioning, and start-up.
To assist in the coordination of all activities related to Electrical engineering design.
To identify any areas of concern with respect to progress and/or quality and recommend corrective actions as required.
Technical Skills: Highly motivated and self-reliant.
Problem solver.
Open analytic thinker and innovator.
Good communicator with willingness to share knowledge and support others.
Strong commitment to safety.

Skills / Qualifications
Industry Experience: Minimum of 10 years’ experience in the oil and gas industry or electrical power generation
Minimum of 6 years’ proven capability in an engineering design company
Operational support / construction and commissioning experience. 
Experience of working with multi-national and multi-cultural project teams is strongly preferred.
Previous experience of working in the Middle East would be an advantage.
Experience of sour service operations would be an advantage
Educational Attainments: Degree in Electrical Engineering (B. Sc./B. Eng./M. Sc.)
Membership of a recognised professional institute preferred
Competencies: Thorough knowledge and understanding of the fundamentals of Electrical engineering design and analysis.

description:
Petrofac is a leading international service provider to the energy industry, with a diverse client portfolio including many of the world’s leading energy companies. We design, build, manage, and maintain infrastructure for our clients. We recruit, reward, and develop our people based on merit, regardless of race, nationality, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, marital status, or disability. We value our people and treat everyone who works for or with Petrofac fairly and without discrimination. The world is re-thinking its energy supply and energy security needs and planning for a phased transition to alternative energy sources. We are here to help our clients meet these evolving energy needs. This is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We support flexible working requests and have adopted a hybrid approach for most of our office-based roles. We ask employees to be present in the office at least three days per week. Petrofac is currently looking to recruit a principal engineer in information management to be based in the UAE. Are you ready to bring the right energy to Petrofac and help us deliver a better future for everyone?JOB TITLE:   PRINCIPAL ENGINEER, INFORMATION MANAGEMENTKEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage the contractor IM team, including document controllers and data controllers.
Coordinate with the company functional support team to set up and configure project document management systems (repository and control) in accordance with this contract.
Manage all paper and electronic document and data flow within the scope of this contract, including sub-contractors or vendors, and report directly to the Technical Services Manager.
Accountable for the implementation of the requirements of Contract Section C6.9.
Executes specific contractual SOW and terms, IM Plan/IM Delivery Plan, input to key project management documents, budget, handover plan, monitoring of QA, and progress management.
Deliver applicable IM deliverables (EDW, SAP-PM, CIMS, Vendor MRB, Critical Documents, 3D models, and other EDS seed files, etc.) as per the project’s closeout requirements Liaise with COMPANY Engineering and Projects IM Manage interfaces with sub-contractors and vendors.
Develop and implement a contract IM strategy and contract IM plan, including associated IM procedures and guidelines and an information handover plan and procedures.
Ensure that the IM Scopes of Work in this contract are reflected in all sub-contracts and requisitions. Develop contract IM KPIs and reports for monitoring progress against contract IM KPIs and the IM Plan. Establish IM Quality Framework for the Contract Conduct self-assessment IM quality health checks.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATION & SKILLS: A minimum of 10 years of experience in projects (oil and gas, petrochemicals, etc.) with more than 5 years’ experience in the information management domain executing specific IM delivery plans
Knowledge and experience of standards and practices related to project IM strategy and planning, project document control, project data control, and handover
Knowledge of project management and engineering processes and interaction with project managers, service managers, project engineers, and discipline engineers
Knowledge and experience of common document and data management tools (such as EDMS, Engineering Data Warehouse, etc.)
Knowledge and experience of typical interaction with subcontractors and suppliers on document and data flow.
       #LI-JN1

description: Location Saudi Arabia, Dammam﻿﻿﻿﻿???? Location: The majority of work will take place on-site at football stadiums in Dammam, with further opportunities for travel across Saudi Arabia and internationally???? Contract: Permanent, Full-Time???? Salary: Competitive???? Start Date: Immediate????*About the Role As a Football Systems Operator, you'll be responsible for setting up, monitoring, and operating our systems on-site at football stadiums in your region. You'll play a key role in the delivery of our services to SAFF, the AFC Champions League and major international tournaments like the World Cup. You will start out working on our Goal Line Technology and Semi Automated Offside services, but there will be the chance to gain exposure to various other services (such as VAR) as you grow in the role and become a more experienced member of the team. We will equip you with the technical training, assistance and full exposure to our systems to excel in this role.????Key Responsibilities Pre-match planning Setting up Hawk-Eye technology in the stadium (this can involve physically demanding work, such as rigging cameras and running cables) Conducting pre-match set up, checks and calibration of the systems in accordance with standard procedures Liaising with stadium staff, match officials and host broadcasters Monitoring the systems during the match Monitoring hardware and software performances, troubleshoot and report encountered issues Taking full ownership of our system on-site and being an ambassador for Hawk-Eye During the off-season, building and maintaining our hardware and equipment Assisting with installation and testing of new products and services ????Your Skills, Knowledge and Expertise A technical background; with a desire to work with and learn new technologies Excellent problem-solving skills coupled with an inquisitive mindset Proactive attitude and good time management skills Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced environment  Ability to liaise with clients and customers in a professional and approachable manner Willingness to travel domestically and to work overseas Flexible and adaptable to a schedule that is dedicated by the fixture list and can change at short notice. We work whenever football happens, which means lots of weekends and evening matches A full valid driving licence is required and willingness to drive our vans Nice to have:  Experience working with video technology/replay technology desirable, or live event/technical production At Hawk-Eye Innovations, we appreciate and value the importance of potential and growth. If you do not hit all of the criteria above but believe that there are certain areas you excel in and that you possess the passion and desire to develop the other attributes, then we encourage you to apply.⚽Make an Impact in the World of Football Join our dedicated and dynamic team and help revolutionise the way technology is used in Football! As a Football Systems Operator, you'll gain invaluable experience and play a crucial role in some of the biggest Football events in the world.

Our Purpose We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results. With its unique category expertise, deep understanding of customer needs and successful track record in addressing complex challenges throughout the payments lifecycle, Master Card Advisors addresses the challenges and opportunities of its clients, enhances Master Card's strategic and tactical performance and establishes Master Card's global thought-leadership pre-eminence. and mid-level clients’ implicit business needs in addition to articulated requests, and identify most critical aspects of the problem• Translate objectives into key hypotheses and structure work for matter experts around goal• Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment• Advanced Word, Excel and Power Point skills• Proficiency in written and verbal English Corporate information being accessed;Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Sr. Custody & Exchange Operations Manager Full-time Company Description Founded and headquartered in Dubai, the United Arab Emirates, Bit Oasis is a leading venture-backed, regulated virtual assets retail trading and custody platform for the GCC and wider Middle East and North Africa region. Bit Oasis shareholders combine best-in-class regional VCs such as Wamda Capital with global virtual asset investors such as Jump Capital, Pantera Capital, and Digital Currency Group. Bit Oasis operates under the supervision of the Dubai Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) and is in the process of acquiring virtual assets licenses and approvals across the region. Job Description The candidate is responsible to efficiently manage the crypto exchange operations whereby they need to protect customer assets, ensure the delivery of orders seamlessly while minimizing exposure to operational, market risks. The successful candidate will be working with various partners to support the onboarding, trading, withdrawal and deposit processes efficiently. The Custody role will require the candidate to assume the responsibility of safeguarding crypto assets, processing token movements to ensure smooth trading and withdrawals, as well as maintaining and performing internal control functions. Role Responsibilities Oversee the day-to-day cryptocurrency operations, including USD and coin settlement with LPs/over platform. Identify & manage initiatives to improve operational processes and reduce operational risk Monitor operational and risk metrics and escalate potential issues or anomalies Support new crypto initiatives from an operational, risk, and compliance perspective Partner with our customer experience and content teams to continuously improve crypto related customer communications Maintain and evolve operating procedures to complement compliance written supervisory procedures Partner with treasury, operations, and security teams to manage liquidity and minimize crypto risk Work closely with fraud and compliance teams to execute a robust AML and KYC program related to crypto Test controls to ensure customers receive exceptional execution quality with venues Coach and manage a team of Crypto Operational Specialists Participate in Bit Oasis Crypto governance committees including a risk committee Ensure all section documentation like Procedure manuals, Control Standards, SLAs etc are up-to-date Ensure that processes are duly followed when performing tasks and checklists are maintained effectively Qualifications BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering and/or similar discipline with analytical bias 8-10 years’ of custody and settlement experience in the financial services industry Possess a good knowledge and understanding of the custody platforms like Bitgo/Fireblocks, experience of working with LPs, and managing an OTC operations is a MUST. Experience in demonstrating problem solving and root cause analysis Highly analytical, detail oriented and strong business sense; proven ability to manage new ideas and creative solutions and demonstrated experience managing such mechanisms to an end result Ability to manage tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, ever-growing and often ambiguous environment; effective multitasking skills are vital Demonstrated effective communication and presentation skills working with multiple peer groups and mid-senior levels of management Take decisions and actions which balance opportunity and risk;Sr. Custody & Exchange Operations Manager Dubai - United Arab Emirates * Full-time
